description:
I finally found the high quality and fresh sushi restaurant I've been looking for!! 

Food: Simply excellent. The fish is fresh, and the rolls are all really good. I also loved the nigiri we got. The rolls were made very well and presented nicely. The portions are on the smaller side, so be sure to order enough. I was impressed and pleased!

Service: Despite the 5 stars for the food, the service was too slow. We spent almost 40 minutes waiting for our food even though there were only two other people in the restaurant when we got there. There was only one waitress and one person making the sushi, which was likely the problem. However, the food was so good that I didn't let this bother me!
author: Nicole D.

description:
Wow. Where do I begin? I hesitated writing a review because I didn't want more people to know about Atami. This is is the hidden sushi spot of the Bay Area.

Firstly, the rice is a 10/10 and so is the fish, but all sushi lovers know it's more about the rice. Everything on the menu is phenomenal. The chef and his wife do an unsurpassable job running the place and making sure quality/service is top notch.

Definitely sit at the bar and chat with Wiley. This place is like any other. If you want good sushi, don't come. If you want incredible sushi, pay them a visit.
author: Myles H.

description:
Atami delivers on its promise of a small, family run sushi bar with fantastic fish and a cozy atmosphere. There are two dozen other joints within walking distance of this place that offer a much different sushi experience than this one, and if you're looking for a higher-end meal, you should take your business down the road. This is my place for a terrific off-hours, sit-down-and-fill-me-up sushi fix. 

On the weekends and during peak hours, this place can move slowly, which is why I tend to regard people who file in her during those times as out-of-town rubes and malcontents. Every time I've been here -- and that's over two dozen times in 10 years -- the service has been wonderful and the food was outstanding. 

Every. 
Single. 
Time. 

If you're visiting San Francisco from out of town, may I recommend Ebisu? Or Ace Wasabi? Or Robin? Or Zushi Puzzle? If you're in search of "destination sushi," this probably isn't your joint. If you live in the neighborhood and can navigate the dinner shifts, there is plenty to satisfy you at Atami.
author: West R.

description: This is probably the best sushi I had on a long time. We had nigiri. Salmon, tuna, scallop, eel, etc. They were all really tasty. You could tell the Chef is a very talented sushi master. Service was perfect and when we went there, it was only locals eating there and coming back often. Do not miss it!
author: Laura P.

description: This is my favorite sushi place in all of San Francisco. Amazing service, great ambiance, and sushi that melts in your mouth.
author: Amir G.

description: NO LONGER KID FRIENDLY. No cooked food: udon- gone, unagi bowl- GONE. No teriyaki. Avoid if u have kids.
author: Paula Y.

description: I got take out last night while on vacation, it was a little hard for me to understand the server but everything came out great. Their service was really quick and the food tasted good. They have a variety of specialty rolls; if you go into the restaurant and look to the left next to the bar they have a ton of special rolls listed that I did not see on their menu so you may want to check there for something special.
author: Kayleigh M.

description:
The service was extremely slow. There was only 1 waitress for the entire restaurant and it took her a long time to come and take our order. We werent even given tea or water before she took our order. 

We ordered the albacore tataki and it was okay. Nothing special. 

The sashimi moriawase also wasnt great. The fish was decent, but not the freshest Ive had. The salmon was the best out of all the fish, so I wish I wouldve ordered some more salmon rolls. 

We ordered the blue fin tuna roll and the maple leaf roll. Neither rolls were good. Not impressed at all. The other reviews are definitely accurate as the rolls are small. Each roll we ordered came with 6 pieces total and each were really small. The maple leaf tuna sounded good, but the spicy sauce added to it ruined the semi sweet taste from the mango. 

Lastly, we ordered uni and amaebi. The uni was not as fresh as hoped and the amaebi was fine but the fried heads were not good at all. Fried heads are typically fried to a crisp, but here it tasted like tempura batter.

Overall the dishes were small and for the quality and size, I do not think it was worth it. I would rather pay a bit more for much better quality. The rolls were not cheap either, $12 for 6 small pieces that did not taste good. 

The service was really slow throughout our meal. We waited at least 10 minutes after we ate each dish to get our next dish. Im not sure what the hold up was. The waitress said the restaurant was busy so it was taking a long time, but if thats the case, then dont seat and serve customers if you cant handle that capacity or hire another waiter. At the very least, you should be able to provide hot tea and water refills without me having to ask.

Unfortunately this place missed on service and food. We will not be returning in the future.
author: Claire W.

description:
I just found this restaurant but here becomes my fav spot
Their fish is so fresh 
The price is reasonable 
Staff is friendly 

They are really honest, if the ingredients r not good enough, they will come and say sorry for u, not like other place that tried to sell u all their shit

Love this place!
author: Yokyok N.

description:
I've been to every great sushi spot in SF and Atami is my neighborhood favorite - if not one of my top 2-3 in all of San Francisco. Great quality. Great ambiance. Amazingly friendly staff.  Atami reminds me of Tokyo - where you can find  small, family run sushi spots tucked away in a neighborhood with a great, intimate vibe reminiscent of Japan. 

Favorites include:

Chu toro nigiri - one of the best in sf

Salmon nigiri - always very fresh

49er roll - thinly sliced lemon over yellow tail and salmon

Maple leaf - my #1. Mango, tuna, siracha wrapped in salmon (see photo)

Red devil - tuna wrapped roll

Less options on the cooked side so I'd recommend coming with sushi lovers. They can do dumplings, tempura and veggie rolls though.
author: Lee S J.

description: I've been on the hunt for a go to sushi place in the marina, sadly this will not be it. The service was extremely slow, I spent a total of 2 hours in the restaurant and it wasn't even a busy night. The fish was okay but nothing special and fairly priced. Attached is the red lion special, it was my favorite roll of the dinner.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Hands down the best sushi around. Pro tip, order from the white board. The Red Devil is an all time fave.
author: Sean G.

description:
Had dinner here with a couple friends. The restaurant was empty when we walked in at 7pm on Saturday. The restaurant is clean and small but homey. 

The food was not great. We ordered edamame, fried soft shell crab, and a couple rolls. The fried soft shell crab smelled just a tad fishy and was not that great. The rolls were pretty average and nothing special. Don't think I would come again for sushi. 

However, the staff here is extremely nice. I saw a homeless man come in to ask for food and they went over and beyond, giving him a little package of food with a drink too.
author: Kyle R.

description: My friends and I were here last night after seeing the reviews on yelp and couldn't have been more disappointed. What we thought was going to be an hour meal turned into almost three hours long. The majority of the time we were waiting for our food as we watched people who had come after us get theirs and leave. The sushi itself wasn't terrible but for the amount of time waited we were expecting at least some fireworks. There was only one woman waiting the tables which was definitely a large part of the problem. Would not return to this establishment.
author: Sydni E.

description:
Unfortunately this was an underwhelming experience. It was dinner for 2 later in the evening and the restaurant was fairly empty. It took the hostess about 10 minutes to seat us (a good 5 before we were spoken to) and then another 15 minutes to approach us at our table. We were tempted to walk out prior to ordering just given how poor the service was, but hungry people can't be choosy people. And we were on foot that night, too fatigued and low on energy to hunt for another restaurant.

The dragon roll and soft shell crab appetizer arrived 25 minutes after ordering. Much to my dismay, the portions were petite to put it nicely. I suppose after spending an hour at a restaurant with no food in sight you develop high expectations. The soft shell crab did appear to be freshly prepared as it was hot in temperature. The flavor was balanced, the crab salted and fried evenly, about a total of 4 very small pieces. The dragon roll was miniature with very little eel and even less rice. The avocado was barely visible, with a small piece of cucumber. I couldn't tell you the quality of the eel as the pieces were so small that I barely tasted it. Water and tea were never refilled. The hostess never reappeared until we flagged her down for our check.

Disappointing to say the least. Costly without justification.
author: Cici T.

description:
Don't come when they open, they might be closed. Don't come hungry, because it takes hours, literally, for your food.

So the first time I come here, I get here when they open around 5, except they aren't open. We wait 30 minutes and nothing. I call back later to see if there signage is wrong, and they let me know they open when they get there, which happened to be around 6pm that day.

Second time it's almost 2 hours before they close. It took over 10 minutes to order, and it's now 5 minutes until they close and no sushi. 10 minutes for water and seaweed salad, 20 minutes for miso and another 30 for sashimi. It took them an hour to cut fish. Not sure how the sushi tastes because it
author: Jeff B.

description: My favorite sushi spot in SF. Quality is second to none. Family owned. Such sweet and gracious owners. Wonderful. Well worth coming here weekly! Great price for the quality.
author: Todd N.

description: Atami sushi is by far the best sushi in the Marina. It is a mom and pop place- the husband & wife have owned it for 18 years. This is definitely not a trendy place but the fish is SO fresh and the rolls are great. The owners are incredibly sweet and it's a fantastic place for a casual, delicious meal.
author: Leigh B.

description: Great little spot ran by a hospitable family trio (husband, wife and son). All about quality, traditional sushi nigiri and rolls! Authentic Japanese interiors and always a delightful dining experience being hosted by this family. It's a local gem and my favorite sushi in the Marina neighborhood.
author: Alex B.

description: Wow what a terrible place to enjoy a drink.  Me and my brother are out-of-towners just on our vacation and we were just looking for a place nearby our hotel for a few drinks and unfortunately we chose this here establishment.  The service was quick we were in and out within 15 minutes (Quick for the wrong reason.  I was actually looking to spend some good money here for drinks).  Let me tell you of this evening.  It was a rainy days, my jacket wet from the pouring rain as we entered the establishment, not a soul to greet us.  I figure it must be a self seating arrangement so we chose seats at the bar.  At the bar was the sushi chef, an elderly asian man who spoke very little to us.  It seemed so unwelcoming.  After a few minutes a little asian women approaches us and ask us to move to a table if we were ordering food as well.  So, we obliged.  I figure why not have some sushi with drinks?  We moved to the nearest table.  My brother place an order for some sushi it arrived when 60 seconds almost like it was prepare before we arrived.  The portion was terrible and didn't looked up to par to the normal quality of rolled sushi.  Our 2 orders of 20 oz Sapporo beers arrive as well.  And, believe it or not within a couple of minutes so did our check.  Now you tell me what was happening this evening. We haven't even taken a bite of our sushi yet or a sip of our beer.  This place was basically rushing to get us out.  I felt like we didn't fit the mold of there standard clients.  It's okay we won't be here to spend our money in the future.  I always believe that it's awesome to help bring business to mom and pops establishment.  But, I don't think this establishment deserves our business.  I left a very good tip but I felt quite cheated.  Oh well,  I hope this helps some other outer towner.  I end this rant with a message.  I hope this establishment stays successful and I hope they open their eyes to the mistreatment of atypical guest.
author: Sam P.

description:
We had a great experience at Atami Sushi!

We came in around 8:30 on a Wednesday evening and sat at the bar. Service was friendly and attentive, and it was nice to seeing all of the sushi rolls being prepared. Everything tasted fresh and well-prepared. My favorite was the burrito roll.

Docking a star because IMO, it was a little overpriced.
author: Audrey A.

description:
I really enjoyed this place. Short walk from the marina inn where we were staying.
Super tidy and clean,  great ambience, good service and the dragon roll was the best ever! Portions were right size for me. Quality food. Reasonable price.
author: Rich B.

description:
Don't eat. They are prejudice. Sushi is average. 
They waitress served other people over us even after we order. 10 people in the entire restaurant including myself and 2 friends. We were the longest waiting patrons and received food after other guest. Nothing complicated was ordered, they chose to serve us second. Took me an hour to get California rolls, spider roll and hurricane roll. All ordered at the same time and came out individually 5-10 minutes apart. I will not return. 
On top of the service being low, the size of the rolls were small and the qualify of the rolls were a C- at best. For the city the quality of fish should be much higher. I've had better sushi in states that do not have oceans let alone are known for the sea food.
author: Kris H.

description: I've been to plenty of sushi restaurants in SF. The quality of fish at Atami is top notch. They hands down make the best 49er roll (salmon with lemon slices) around. Other great options are the Uncle Jack and Burrito roll. If you are a fan of sashimi, you won't be disappointed by the salmon. Wiley and Michele are the most welcoming hosts it feels like home every time.
author: Eric J.

description:
Surprisingly good sushi for a low profile joint. Nice ambience, decent but really slow service, so don't come here with a growling tummy.

=== Food
Ordered a Dragon roll (4/5), Spider Roll (4/5) and a Bulls Eye Roll (5/5). The portion and size of sushi are much smaller compared to the many sushi joints i have visited. Typically 2 of the sushi rolls would have filled the two of us, for today, we ordered three sushi rolls! The sushi tasted really good and fresh, which is key especially when for raw sushi. Am keeping this place in my list, pretty sure I will be back for sushi someday if we are around the block.

=== Service
Decent service but it was unbelievable slow. Three sushi rolls and we spend approximately 1.5 hours in the restaurant. We were not eating slowly by the way, once the plate arrive, we were digging into the food and finish them in less than 5 mins. The ordering, preparing, serving, billing and even asking to have our green tea replenish took quite awhile. 

To a certain extent, i can understand why as they only had 1 server working the floor and looks like theres only 1 sushi chef but i might be wrong. Even so, the server wasn't attentive, we had to ask repeatedly to have our drink replenished and for more wasabi. 

== Parking
Street parking in this area. No restrictions for weekend. Weekdays - 2 hours parking. You probably have to do quite a bit of circling before you land a good spot. 

Overall, i am impressed with the quality of sushi. They are not the omakase standard but definitely one that is above average sushi joints. Highly recommend when you have that Japanese food craving but just remember not to come with an empty stomach.
author: Cindee T.

description: Favorite sushi in the marina. Low key atmosphere with fresh fish and delicious rolls. This place is run by a very friendly married couple who opened up 18 years ago. Don't be distracted by the other trendy sushi places in the marina; if you want high quality sushi in this neighborhood Atami is the place. Highly recommend.
author: Piero M.

description:
My husband and my daughter came here on a Thursday night, at around 7.  It was relatively packed as the restaurant is not huge.  We were seated right away, in the back.  Like most Yelpers already mentioned, service is slow here. There are only 3 people working. 1 older man making sushi, 1 woman serving and 1 other person cleaning dishes in the back.  I feel that there should just hire another server because it took a long for the woman to come to our table each step of the way... to give us our menus, to take our orders, to bring us our drinks, the list goes on...down to giving back our credit card after we paid. Took forever.    

Here are a few things about the food:  
1.  Taste was good.  The rice was just the right consistency, not too mushy, not too hard.  The salmon was fresh.     
2.  Portions are small, way too small.  We ordered 2 California Rolls, 1 Rock and Roll, 2 pcs Salmon Nigiri, 1 Shrimp Tempura Roll, 1 Spider Roll and 2 miso soups for 2 adults and a 5-yr old.  At the end, we were still NOT full.  Total bill - $61 without drinks.  
3.  The rolls are sloppily made.  They don't hold together and it will break apart when you bring them to your plate. 

I've experienced better service, had better sushi and paid less.  I'm not coming back.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
The couple who run this restaurant are very kind courteous and pay attention to detail. It's only the two of them but when I stopped by to pick up there were only two other customers. It's a very calming environment. 

I am not sure how the experience will be if it's crowded

I ordered Salmon Nigiri and the quality of the Salmon was outstanding. It's a short menu which I suspect is they try to do things well. That's common in Asia where some restaurants specialize in just one dish. 

The sheer quality will ensure that I will be back
author: Joe V.

description:
Food is great. Service is slow. There is one waitress who is very overwhelmed. Recommend getting takeout. 

Would have give 5 stars if it hadn't taken over an hour to get our sushi.
author: Samantha P.

description:
We walked in at 9pm and saw that there was no available table. It took the server (I think she owned the place too) 15 mins to go up to us and tell us that it would be a little bit of a wait. We still stayed and that was a big mistake! 15 mins more, she told us that our table would be ready soon and sat us after 10 more mins. Take note: we were the only ones waiting to be seated and it took 40 mins! 

So after waiting for 40 long mins to get seated, the food took as long!! We were hoping to be blown away but NO. We ordered 3 meals and some sake. Each meal was sent every 10-15mins. What a joke! There was only one lady serving the entire restaurant on a Saturday night! I talked to this other customer and she said it was their second time there and there was only one server too on their first time. Lastly, even getting the check took forever.

Bad service, serving is small, food was nothing special and pricey for what you pay for. Yes, the server/ owner lady was nice and I appreciated it but that doesn't justify the really bad management and mediocre food.
author: Angel Y.

description: Excellent restaurant----excellent friendly staff, great rolls.  Prefer the Mali to the nigiri and the tempura but everything was good.
author: N S.

description: Best neighborhood sushi restaurant in the Marina. Small and family run with amazing service and high quality food. We have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. Even though it's on Lombard you'd never know it by the quiet and cozy atmosphere. Go once and you will become a regular!
author: Kelly M.

description:
My taste buds were jumping for joy! Seriously the fish was so fresh and amazing, plus they had unique special rolls with the most savory combination of flavors (i.e. the Maple Leaf roll with salmon, mango and spicy tuna!). To top it off, service was amazing and you could tell it's a real authentic sushi restaurant. Our server was so kind and soft spoken and the sushi chef served up the tastiest rolls I've had in awhile (see above). 

Sure, the rolls are a bit smaller than one might usually expect, but the price is also significantly lower than any other sushi place in town AND the fish is fresher. Thank you, Atami! You're our new go-to spot for amazing fish and the perfect low-key date night experience.
author: Alisa C.

description:
Family run. High quality and fresh fish. Calm and relaxing atmosphere.

The sashimi is some of the best i've had and eat sushi everywhere. The rolls are reasonably priced, especially for SF.

This has become my go to sushi spot.
author: Ian G.

description: Love this place! The (I believe) owners, were so nice and sweet! The rolls were so good! And the green tea!
author: Meghan H.

description:
This place is always so good. It's our go to neighborhood spot and a really good place for a date if you want to get to know the person. It's not gimmicky or loud and flashy, just really great foot at a family owned and run spot. 

Things aren't rushed here but they're not as slow as some of the other reviews might indicate. 

The regular rolls are great but be sure to try the 49er roll if you like light tastes and are looking for something different. The lemon is sliced incredibly thin and the whole roll is just amazing.
author: Matt P.

description: OMFG, the burrito roll is the bomb.com. If you have to choose between attending attending your first born child's birth or trying the burrito roll for lunch, make the wise choice and order a saki with it!!! Will be back when in San Francisco again.
author: Lucas C.

description: Michelle and Wiley are excellent hosts and their sushi is excellent.  Definitely try their burrito roll.   As a special tip, ask them about the secret parking lot out back.
author: Mark K.

description: Exceptionally fresh sushi and elegantly-presented rools at this authentic little gem. Several patrons knew the owners by name. To me, this is the model of what an aithetic, friendly and delicious neighborhood sushi restaurant should be. Very fairly priced for dinner
author: Joe S.

description:
My favorite sushi place in the entire bay area (maybe even my favorite in all of California). The fish is always fresh, the sushi rolls are creative and well-done, and the customer service is lovely. We discovered the place after being disappointed by some other Sushi Restaurants in SF and we have been regulars since more than two years. 
At times when the restaurant is really busy, you might have to wait for a little while but every pice of sushi eaten afterwards is absolutely worth it. Also, the restaurant is owned and managed by a lovely couple, with the husband being the chef as well. In our fast paste world with big chain restaurants, nothing makes me happier than small, family owned businesses. 
The ambiance at Atami is nice, nothing too fancy, but the restaurant is well-designed and very clean. I particularly appreciate, that you have can see everything being prepared while waiting which makes the experience even better. Additionally, each sushi roll is served individually, similar to restaurant I visited during my frequent trips to Japan.
author: Kathrine P.

description:
If you're in the Marina and happen to want sushi, Atami will be your best bet.  In fact, they have no hot meals (besides appetizers - gyoza, etc) - it's all nice, fresh fish.

Small, cozy, mom and pop fish shop that unfortunately has higher prices and smaller portions than the rest of the sushi places in SF.  Most of my chirashi was fresh except for one piece of unidentified fish, which looked stringy and tasted off (I immediately spat it back out).  It wasn't the traditional chirashi with the egg and various types of fish; instead, I think I received 3 types of fish only (about 2-3 slices each), a piece of very overcooked shrimp, and a piece of octopus.  All for $19 - which is quite pricey, considering the size of the whole thing.

The rolls are good - we ordered two, but they're only 6 small pieces each for over $11+ per roll - again, quite expensive for the quantity.

Solid food in terms of quality, but the price and quantity are lacking.  Go here over the other sushi joints in the Marina (Sushi IN, Naked Fish, etc) but if you are willing to travel up the hill, head to Elephant Sushi instead.
author: Tori S.

description:
I believe this will be my first Yelp review to ever post and I am doing so because I truly LOVE this spot.  My boyfriend and I have been coming here for about a year and a half and it has become not only our favorite sushi spot, but one of our favorite spots in the city, that also holds so many fond memories for us.  We are both foodies and have scoured this city tasting all the great sushi spots....and out of them all, Atami tops our list for several reasons, which are listed below.  

Quality: If you truly enjoy raw fish and are not seeking another gimmicky sushi spot, you will not be disappointed.  The sashimi and nigiri are very fresh and amazing quality!  We have had just about every fish on the menu and our top 4 favorites are Sake Toro, Hamachi Toro, Albacore Toro & Aji. All of these cuts are very tender and have the perfect texture and flavor.  The Albacore Toro is absolutely delicious....it literally melts in your mouth.  If you are going to order rolls, make sure to order the 49er roll and the Crazy roll.  The 49er roll has avocado inside of rice (no seaweed) with salmon and lemon on top.  The lemon is divine, as it is cut VERY thin and adds the perfect flavor without bite.  Also, if you enjoy miso soup, make sure to begin your meal with a cup, as theirs is certainly worth enjoying!

Service: A husband, wife and son own and run the restaurant.  You can tell they put their heart and soul into ensuring their customers have the best quality fish and overall experience.  We have a tendency of coming to eat a bit late and they have never once turned us down, but welcomed us without hesitation.  The wait is standard with what you would find at most sushi spots.  We typically enjoy wine or sake when eating at Atami and have never had to wait for beverages.  Due to the size of the space, I would recommend keeping your group to no more than 5 people.

Atmosphere & Location:  The restaurant is a small and quaint location, with a very relaxing and intimate ambiance.  I always feel at home when eating here.  The space is well kept and is always clean.  If you do not live in the area, I would recommend taking a Lyft or Uber, as it can be tough to find parking in the Marina district.
author: Sarah S.

description: Fresh fish great service delicious sushi couldn't have asked for a better place. Picked this place based off of reviews and I wasn't led astray. Perfect lil hole in the wall sushi had the caterpillar rainbow and some sweet shrimp sushi.
author: Stefani T.

description: Fresh and Delicious original shushi place, very good prices , nice cozy place ,  also vegetarian sushi in case you are allergic.
author: Esmeralda L.

description: We stopped here for dinner because it was close to where we were staying, and we had read good reviews on Yelp. Unfortunately it left something to be desired. It was a little hole-in-the-wall place and was kind of lacking ambiance. It wasn't very crowded, especially given that it was a Friday, but we were hopeful that the sushi would blow us away. Unfortunately the portions were all pretty small and the sushi was just average...nothing special at all. I just wasn't crazy about this place or the service. I wouldn't go back or recommend it to others....there are too many other great places out there!
author: Nicole D.

description:
I love this sushi place! I come all the time and they always have great specials.  The nigiri is always super fresh and their specialty rolls are great. My favorite is the Atami Yummy but you can't go wrong with any of them. The staff is always super friendly and remember me when I come in which is great! 

I highly suggest this place if you're looking for a good spot in the Marina that isn't too expensive but still has amazing sushi.
author: Julia K.

description: Dinner here was the perfect treat after spending the entire day touring the city. We were more than ready to sit down, relax, and enjoy some good food- all of which was offered at Atami Sushi. The menu was more limited than I'm use to, but everything we ordered came out fantastic. It was all about quality over quantity here. We ordered several rolls to split: the Red Devil, Elegant Roll, and the Hurricane Roll. Each came out one by one which turned out to be a good thing since it allowed me to actually taste and savor every bite. The food is on the pricier end given that there is only 6 small pieces per order, but everything tasted so fresh and the combinations were unique. The Red Devil is definitely added to my mental list of "best sushi rolls I've tried."
author: Tiffany C.

description: Went for the first time last night (Friday) and it was very easy to get a last minute reservation, which usually makes me a little worried about what I'm getting myself into. Not the case with Atami! Every roll we ordered was a 10/10. The fish was so buttery, fresh, and amazing. Our favorites were the Sea Breeze and the Blue Hawaii from the specials menu. It's a relatively quiet, small restaurant with just 2-3 employees. Already looking forward to our next visit.
author: Bry F.

description:
Atami? More like Atomically Awesome!

Friend and I walked in on a weekend night around 7pm and had no trouble getting a seat. The quiet, laid back, and cozy nature of Atami was wonderful. Very hidden gem.

This place appears to be run by one lady and one gentleman, both wonderfully nice! You could tell by some of the customers, that people come in and know them.

What we had:
- 5 stars: Red Devil - tuna, salmon, avocado, and lemon. The tuna curves around the outside and the 6 pieces of the roll style into a flower. You must get this roll!

- 4 stars: Blue Moon - spicy tuna, avocado, cucumber, and butterfish. Tasty treat.

- 4 stars: Burrito - spicy tuna, avocado, and shrimp tempura. The flavors of this roll are very interesting and really come together as you are mid chew.

- 5 stars: Salmon Sashimi - some of the best salmon I have had. Had to stop myself from ordering a second order.
author: Rachel R.

description: This place is PHENOMENAL. I am a sushi snob, and there is no better quality and presentation than at Atami. Ask for Nigiri Omakase to put your selection in the Chef's exceedingly capable hands, and you will be rewarded with tastes and sensations difficult to find anywhere except in Tokyo's best sushi bars. With limited free lot parking as part of the deal, Atami might just be SF's best-kept sushi secret.
author: Mitch S.

description: This is by far my favorite sushi restaurant. The head chef and server are beyond friendly and welcoming, and their sushi stands far above any other mainstream restaurants in SF and well beyond, in my opinion. There are always open seats here, despite being a small and understated restaurant. I can tell most of their visitors are loyal locals who have been going here for decades. Their fish is so fresh and tasty compared to other sushi places, using less rice and more delicate fish. This is an ideal date night spot that is cozy and comfortable from the moment you walk in.
author: Allison L.

description: Intimate, tucked away sushi spot with good service. The chūtoro, dragon roll, and 49er roll were all great -- especially loved the paper thin slices of lemon on the 49er. Would definitely go back!
author: DeAnna C.

description: I just tried Atami for the first time. It's a great local marina sushi spot! Small, family operated, super clean and fresh sushi. Our server was attentive and friendly. Give it a try and you will definitely go back.
author: Chris C.

description: This was hands down the best sushi I have ever eaten. I am from Northern Texas where fresh seafood does not abound. The seafood in the rolls I ordered was so fresh and delicious. I ordered the shrimp tempura roll and the shrimp was hot and the veggies were cool. The NY Maki roll was equally delicious. This is not a place you come to eat fast and furious. These rolls are hand made by one sushi chef. I am telling you, it is worth the wait! If you are starving when you get here, order a Sapporo, Sake, and an appetizer or soup. The kitchen is fast. Amazing plain and simple! If you are a tourist in San Fran, this tiny neighborhood sushi restaurant needs to be on your list.
author: Rebecca E.

description:
I've been to countless sushi places around the city - this place is a hidden gem!

My boyfriend lives next door, and we LOVE sushi, so we come here a lot! The sushi has always been amazing, the service is fantastic (we always have the same waitress, she is the sweetest!), and it's always nice and quiet. It's far enough away from the marina to find some solitude from the gross, bourgeois people while still enjoying quality food and service. Week nights are best. So chill.

Love this place!
author: Anah R.

description:
OOOOH YUM. My friend lives a few blocks away so this tiny place is his local haunt. I joined him for dinner with a bunch of friends and this place definitely hit the spot. I ordered a couple different rolls, and they were super filling and delicious. They have a great specials menu, and I don't think you can really go wrong. It's funny, we can't see the little board, so they bring it over to the table when you're ordering. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

AND they were able to take my reservation for 6 people on a Friday night just like an hour or 2 before we wanted to come in!
author: Vivian H.

description: This place was a cute hideaway restaurant in the middle of San Francisco. Not busy on a Friday night, intimate dining experience, you get to watch the sushi chef prepare your food, and the waitress was adorable. It was a bit slow but what do you expect when there's more than four hungry people in the place and one chef? Didn't take away from the atmosphere at all. Would definitely go back when I'm in the city again!
author: Krisinda K.

description:
I have been here a few times as my apartment is very close. I usually come alone which most people do not seem to do but I always enjoy it. I bring a book have some hot sake or wine and eat my fill. 


The service is friendly and the chef is hard at work preparing food. 


They have a variety of delicious rolls and lots of options. I will continue to come back here and bring friends! So far my favorite spot for sushi in the marina/cow hollow area. 


Keep in mind the space is small so probably not a place to eat with 30 of your friends but they can accommodate bigger groups. There is one waitress, she is so kind and quick but do keep in mind that when it's packed the service may not be lightening  speed. I personally am not bothered by this because I clearly enjoy the atmosphere and food. 

Check this spot out for some good eats. You won't be disappointed.
author: Kristin F.

description: Very solid rolls and decent prices. Small place and although it says, may not be the best place for kids.  Service is very polite, but be prepared to wait a bit for some rolls, but the ambience of the place is fine for waiting.  Overall a good find!
author: John R.

description: This place rocks! Best sushi joint in the marina. The quality of fish is outstanding and the mom and pop owners are so sweet!!! Come here if you want amazing food and quality people
author: Lara S.

description: Don't know what's up with all the 5 star reviews. The fish tastes fishy and the service is painfully slow. Would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Arian M.

description:
A hidden gem! Why 5 stars?

1) hands down fantastic sushi 
2) consistently good (been there several times)
3) sweetest server
4) tucked away from the crowded madness 
5) sweetest server (yes, she gets another star just for how nice she is)

Thank you Atami for always providing us our sushi fix!
author: Tarun P.

description:
This place rocked. I was actually on the way to a different place when we passed Atami. Quick yelp check and it looked better than the place we were going so we stopped here.

Salmon, excellent. Nice, fatty. Had the live scallop. It was a little grainier than I expected but still good. Had a round of oysters, tasty as well. Blue crab roll, albacore, spicy tuna hand roll all excellent.

Service wasn't spot on but nothing too slow. Pieces came out as they were made, not all at once. Not the best sushi in the world but very solid and nothing tasted off. Good quality stuff, reasonably priced for the area. Definitely check it out.
author: Tanna L.

description: Neighborhood Sushi restaurant run entirely by a family, it is small so be prepared to wait a little if you come during busy hours. Service is otherwise excellent. The sushi is great and reasonably priced though. The portions tend to be a bit on the small side, the fish is always fresh and there's enough variety to try something new every time. Our favorites are the 49ers, caterpillar roll and rock and roll.
author: Daniel L.

description: I would give them zero if I could. Worst place ever. Sat for 30 mins without any service.
author: CC C.

description: Some of the best fish I have had! So fresh and tender! The rolls are very small or else I would have given it a 5 star. I ordered the rainbow roll and N.Y Maki. Very good. Would like to try the 49er next time.
author: Morgan L.

description: I feel really bad for the three stars because the food is really good.  But.. the wait to get our food was kinda bad, probably waited about an hour to get our sushi...  We did get our drinks and miso soup quickly. It looks as though there is 1 sushi chef, 1 waitress and 1 cook so If you are hungry you may want to try elsewhere, if u don't mind waiting go for it!
author: Krystof A.

description: Great little hole in the wall! Amongst the best sushi I've tried..the rolls are rather small, so take that into account when ordering..if you feel like a quiet night with someone special this is a good place to go for some good sushi and great conversation.
author: Sean R.

description: Yummy!  Listen to their suggestions,  fresh and good!  Great walking distance from Marina district hotels.  Will return next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Tami Lyn C.

description:
The sushi here is delicious but the service is not as impressive. 

I've been here twice; the first time I ordered pick up and when we got there, they had forgot our order. The second time, the server almost ignored us, and it took ages before we got our food. 

It is definitely worth going here for the quality of the sushi, but if you easily get frustrated with slow service I would order pick up. The dragon roll is amazing and the seaweed salad is great.
author: Erica W.

description: My husband and I really enjoyed our experience here. We had some nigiri (salmon, halibut, albacore) and rolls (sea breeze, bullseye, 49er) and were very pleased with the freshness of the food. Our favorites by far were the salmon nigiri and sea breeze roll (spicy tuna and avocado roll with seaweed on top). Service was great, plating of the food was lovely, and the place was very clean. I'm not sure why everyone thinks the serving sizes are too small; this is pretty much what I experience at other sushi restaurants: 2 nigiri pieces per order or 6 pieces per roll. If I lived here I'd be a regular at this restaurant.
author: Celeste L.

description: Amazing traditional sushi, but because of the portion size I'm going to have to give it 4 stars.  The rolls came cut in 6 pieces and they were smaller than what I'm used to (we're from LA).  I wish I took photos but we were starving and we gobbled it down in 2 bites (literally).  Also, we requested more ginger twice and it didn't seem like the waitress liked that, she gave us the look of, "wtf you all ate it all already?!" Again, sushi is amazing, just don't expect big portions and brush off the little details.
author: Lana A.

description:
Came here after Zushi Puzzle turned us away for not having reservations, despite a half-filled restaurant. We were the only ones in the restaurant save for a guy at the counter who I think was an employee. We ordered three rolls, they each came out like one at a time, like 15 minutes apart.  Super small rolls, 6 pieces per $11 roll. We were still pretty hungry after finishing the three rolls. Super nice waitress. Super slow service. 
I said "super" a lot, but this place was anything but. 
I really should know better than to get sushi in the marina.
author: Christine Y.

description: Cute little neighborhood sushi bar that I stumbled upon because Yelp said it was the closest restaurant from my hotel and I could only walk to dinner. Service was good, food was good, and I like little mom & pop places like this. While I wasn't a fan of my hotel, I would come back to the neighborhood just to eat here.
author: John D.

description: Came for a solo sushi dinner, and enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and great service.  It was certainly good enough to come back to the following day with friends.  The first night I sat at the sushi bar, and received friendly and prompt service, from both the sushi chef and server.  Definitely a hidden gem, and I recommend it to anybody looking for quality sushi at a fair price.
author: Matthew R.

description: Best sushi I've found in this neighborhood. It's sad that they don't deliver but they are pretty centrally located. The only downside is the wait for the food. The place never seems to be busy but I've been three times now and have had issues with the service each time.
author: Therese M.

description: This place is amazing! Fresh sushi and great service. We stayed way too long and they never made us feel rushed. Michelle is so great! Can't wait to be back!
author: Erin H.

description:
We recently discovered this place just around the corner from our apartment. I got teriyaki  salmon and it was great. I'm dying to try their sushi.

Everything was on the expensive side but the quality was great.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
This place is definitely over-rated... like Jenny L. says, probably due to convenience.

My BF&I had somewhere to be but wanted to grab a quick bite, and Atami Sushi popped up. This is a small quiet little mom&pop sushi bar with a very warm and inviting ambiance - minus the clearly intoxicated party trying to talk and barter business deals... BUT, the serving sizes here are just ridiculously small + everything just ridiculously over-priced for what was also just mediocre sushi - picture to prove it: http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=RugiruRsLxooWa5aE5Z5lg ... I hate having to bag on any small mom&pop business, but y'all need to know... Maybe it was because I ordered to-go? But still, I don't think that gives any excuse for how my BF&I were still hungry after paying close to $40 for a few pieces of what was not even high quality sushi. 

Seared Tuna w/ Shrimp Tempura (forgot the name) Roll, $11.50 - 6 measily pieces with no distinct taste
Unagi and Cucumber Roll, $6.50 - 6 equally measily pieces... but at least they tasted okay?
Garlic Albacore, $5.00 - meh... the fish was warm and it overall was not enjoyed
Poke Salad (not pictured), $6.50 - best thing of the lot - prob thanks to the spiciness - but nothing worth writing home about

I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, and prob not even if it were convenient... Zushi Puzzle is just down the street, and would probably be a better bet.
author: Lana N.

description:
The only reason why this place is rated so highly is perhaps because of convenience for those who don't want to venture farther for higher prices.  It seems to be by Chinese staff, who either choose lower grade fish or freeze it a few times to lose its fresh flavor.  It's not bad, but it's not worth the price for the portions and quality.  They seem to have a variety of special rolls and fish that may be worth trying.    

The staff is friendly, but a bit slow.  Ambiance and decor is similar to most traditional Japanese restaurants with the wooden furnishings except for the neon lighting outside.  Parking can be tough on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Trying it all...still my favorite.

Red Devil roll is awesome. I love the sans seaweed and loads of fish.

LOVE!
author: Meredith M.

description: Excellent.  Good pacing, lovely sashimi, really succulent salmon and yellowtail.  Seaweed salad was tasty, miso was also really good.  Environment was much nicer than I expected for Lombard.  Great spot!
author: Adam A.

description:
Came here twice now and left disappointed both times. 

Came here on a Saturday night with no reservations and we were the only ones in the restaurant the whole time.

Service:
It took a while to get some attention and some water in our glasses but the we finally ordered. Kind of slow the rest of our meal.

Food:
+Seaweed Salad- this was actually tasty
+Tofu & Mushroom Roll- very bland and non-filling
+Burrito Roll- ordered this since everyone on yelp raved about. Well, I guess everyone lied cuz it was just horrible. A tiny 6 piece roll ($11) with a sliver of cold shrimp in there and nothing on top to dress it up. Pathetic.
+Age Dashl Tofu- deep fried with rump sauce so unhealthy and unsatisfying

Ambience:
Small hole in the wall type restaurant with limited seating and kind of cramped.

I'd be willing to come back if there was an amazing roll to try next time but it looks bleak.

Left disappointed and hungry. :(

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
The service is incredibly slow and it wasn't much food for the price. We waited about 2 hours to get a roll each and the waitress ignored us for most of the night without checking in. About an hour after ordering, she came in to tell us the machine in the kitchen was broken and promptly left without another word. Over the next hour, our food trickled in and the waitress wouldn't stop for a second to check in, refill our drinks or take other orders. The machine wasn't her fault but she handled things pretty poorly.

At the very least, the fish was fresh, albeit there was little of it.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Their yellowtail nigiri is amazing! Really great small sushi place. Sit at the bar, the head chef is super sweet!
author: Emily I.

description:
Me thinks this place doth not deserve four stars! 

I made a reservation here for dinner on NYE 2013 (just in case there was a wait which could potentially divert my festive plans). Well... when our party arrived... they couldn't look up the reservation and told us we never called. I guess I didn't and probably just dreamt it! 

I got the 49ner Roll for $7.95 and received about 6 pieces of mediocre sushi. And please check my other reviews, I am not a picky eater. 

Everyone ended up adding more food halfway through the meal because it wasn't satisfying. I added the Beef Teriyaki, which turned out to be quite good, but again, the portions could be a little more generous. My friends got the Gyu Don (Thin sliced beef, tofu and onion cook in special sukiyaki sauce) and was adequately dissatisfied, again. 

All in all, I think there are better sushi places out there with better service and/or portion-to-price ratio. And, let me remember to mention that it wasn't crowded (since I visit them on what presumably could have been a busy night).
author: Henry N.

description:
Thank you Atami for probably the best sushi experience I've had in the Marina to date! Unsuspecting from the outside, you're welcomed into a small, cozy, amazingly-lit world away from the hustle and bustle of Lombard Street the minute you step inside this restaurant. 

Barely 10 tables or so, the restaurant is small, customer-focused, and obviously takes care in presenting fresh, well-made food.

I tried the following items:
- Gyoza
- Elegant roll
- Marina roll (off the daily specials menu) 

As a picky sushi eater, everything was surprisingly tasty! The items weren't overly fishy and didn't leave a bad aftertaste in my mouth, which is always a sign of good fish and even better preparation.

Clearly the restaurant catered to a lot of regulars, both for dining in and take-out. Hopefully the secret doesn't get out, but this is definitely a place to mark on your must-try list! :)

P.S. About 4 tables were occupied, but service was a bit slow due to only one server and a small kitchen. Definitely make sure you have the time to eat in, otherwise take-out is a reasonable option.
author: Mansi A.

description: This is a straight up sushi only kind of place. The nigiri is proportional,  and perfect with just the right amount of wasabi. We were super happy eating here.
author: Jaz V.

description: sushi rolls are pretty good, but didnt have a good experience with the temparu， a bit pricy
author: Xi C.

description: Perfect neighborhood sushi bar! We live close by and have been going for 8 years. Never disappoints!  Sushi is fresh and creative and the owners are great.
author: Heather C.

description:
I'd round up to 3.5 stars if I could...I really try not to give negative reviews, but I must be honest, this place was just underwhelming.  I was expecting to be a little more pleased given the reviews.  

Here was the line-up: 
- 13 piece Nigiri B (sashimi was ok but not the freshest I've had in the city, and my bf even called the pieces he had "warm"...a word that should never be used when talking raw fish!)
- Seaweed salad (tasty....but it's just seaweed....)
- Crazy roll (I thought this was really lacking in flavor, and for the price, it was tiny!)

I'm not sure I'd come back here, but I was glad I gave it a try.  I think next time I'll stick with Wayo Sushi, old faithful!
author: Brianna M.

description: The sushi here are just not that good. 49's rolls was not tasty at all, rainbow roll just ok. Kinda disappointed
author: Olga R.

description:
I went to this place based on other yelpers, and I must say the sushi is good. Super fresh and tasty. The items on the special is the way to go, but the only draw back from this cozy family run joint is the service. It was so so slow. I don't know if they were having an off night or what, but we were there for about 1.5 - 2 hours for only 3 people. 

Most of the time was attributed to waiting. The main course came out before the appetizer, and the sushi rolls were brought out with a 15-20 minute gap in between from one another. There was no word or check up from the waitress. I mean there was only 2 other tables. I was very impatient by the end of the night, but the food was good.
author: Minette C.

description:
Yummy and fresh sushi! Miso soup was a little salty but really tasty. Had sake sashimi - so fresh the salmon melted in my mouth. Also had the Blue Moon roll w spicy tuna, avocado, and butterfish. So delish! 

Love that the chef uses minimal rice on the rolls so you really get to taste the fish. Staff was friendly and attentive. Nice decor, quiet and welcoming.
author: Sharmin K.

description:
I am still puzzled... Why is this place getting four stars?  I have tried many Japanese restaurants and had much better experience in a place with getting just 3 stars...

First off, the portion was incredible small!  We ordered two rolls ($11-12 each).  Both of the rolls had only six tiny teeny pieces.  It was like a child meal.  We are completely shocked when they brought the dishes.  I was not impressed with the quality of the sushi either... It was so disappointing....
author: M Y.

description: Atami was recommended to us awhile back and we happened to be in SF and decided to give them a taste. We were not disappointed. We started with the Gyoza and they were the perfect size for an appetizer. The flavor was great and they had the perfect combination of crisp and chewy. Then the rolls! Atami Yummy, Kamikaze and two others I can't recall the names of. Fresh and very tasty. Perfect portions. Love the low key ambiance and the friendly staff. Thanks for a tasty dinner.
author: Joann G.

description: I have tried many sushi places, but this particular place is my favorite.  Service is good.  The food and quality are even better.  It's a little far of a drive for me but it's a must-go place when I visit the city.
author: Mindy C.

description: Visited San Francisco for two nights. This place was near our hotel & I had a craving for sushi, so this is what we picked. Sushi was so good as well as the service, that we returned on our second night! The woman who seated us both nights was friendly & sat us right away. She was attentive & noticed us the minute we walked in. Cute, cozy place. Not too big, but it was perfect & just what we were looking for. Can't really remember what we ordered, but we tried a few different maki rolls, a couple being the fried ones they heat with a blow torch. Service is pretty quick, too. Prices are fair.
author: Ashley A.

description: This place is a 10 minute walk from Chestnut Street in the Marina, but definitely worth a visit!  All the special rolls I ordered were great - Blue Hawaii, Blue Moon, Ginza.  Much better than what you can get at, say Naked Fish, on Chestnut.  It is also not overly crowded even on the weekends, probably because of the somewhat remote location.  A hidden gem in the Marina!
author: Stephen K.

description: This place is great. We went once out of convenience and found a hidden gem. Service is good and Michelle and Wiley couldn't be nicer. My go to sushi spot!
author: Ben W.

description: Incredible environment. You get what you pay for. Great small family owned business atmosphere, the wait is worth it, and you know it's fresh to you. It was a great choice on a Saturday at 9:30 pm. No background music, not a lengthy menu. Get the hand rolls and the 49ers roll.
author: Lauren J.

description: Our sushi was pretty unoriginal, but fresh and tasted good. Would recommend here if you're not looking to travel outside of the marina area.
author: Sarah B.

description: Good sushi,  small serving. Understaffed on a Saturday. Too slow. Manager needs to address.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
I am currently staying at the Francisco Inn on Lombard and Franklin street. I wanted to have a good last meal before going back to New York and I was craving sushi. Since I didn't have a car, I wanted somewhere close yet good. Now I LOVE SUSHI and although I will admit that I sometimes eat at those 50% off sushi places  in NYC, when I do splurge on good quality... I always expect the best of the best.

So I found this place and it was down the block from the motel and decided to give it a try. So here's the breakdown:

Restaurant Environment and Service:
The place itself is quite small and mainly should be enjoyed as a more intimate setting. Large parties I would not suggest it. But the place itself is very nice and quiet. So you can easily unravel and relax in this place.
Service wise... It is run by two to three people max. Two, who are the owners... One does the sushi and the other is the waitress. The third I'm not sure what he does... But because of this... Service is slow as stated by past reviewers. So when you come here make sure you're in the mood to really sit and relax while enjoying the food. If your in a rush DO NOT come here.  But either than that... The people are ridiculously nice and welcoming. 

Food:
So of course eating raw fish... It is a concern if the food is good or not. I decided to try three items, each of a different variety of the menu. I ordered the Kaze (I think that's the name) which Is 8 pieces of salmon sashimi, unagi nigiri, and a kamikaze roll (spicy tuna inside with ahi tuna outside)
Salmon sashimi (~$14)- delicious! Fresh tasting and almost melts in your mouth. 
Unagi (~$6)- fresh tasting and actually quite surprisingly satisfying. I'm so used to eel just cooked with the sauce on top but for this they put the eel in the oven to make the outside a little crispy and then out just a good amount if sauce... Nothing over the top. This was definitely one of my top choices out of the three.
Kamikaze roll (~$12)- this one was okay. The spicy tuna did have quite a unique preparation. I've been very used to it being minced and mixed with the spicy sauce but this seems to be a whole piece marinated or lathered with some of the spicy sauce. That was the part that wash emo st unique but overall I would say this roll was okay. 

Cost:
So this place was a little bit expensive, but I think it is worth it considering some of the very good tasting sushi and also the service and environment. The bill totaled to about $33.00 and some change. 

Overall: 4.0/5
I would suggest this place to those who wants to relax and really enjoy their dinner. So that means they are in no rush... Since dishes seem to come out one after the other. While eating I see many locals order take out and some seem to be regulars being known by name and everything. The food is quite good and considering how some of the food is made quite unique compared to other sushi restaurants, it is worth a try.
author: Anthony T.

description: Awesome reasonably priced sushi! It's nothing fancy but the fish is high quality and the service is great.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Atami is a great neighborhood treasure. Terrific sushi and wonderful service! 

Owned and operated by a husband (chef) and wife (server), Atami offers great sushi at good prices in a comfortable, family-friendly atmosphere. If you're looking for a hot and trendy spot, you might look elsewhere. However, if you want a casual, delicious dinner, you'll have a great time at Atami.

We ordered:
- the 49er roll was my favorite. Very, very good!
- the Burrito roll was solid 
- the Paradise roll was okay, but had too much basil for my taste
- the Miso soup with mushroom was delicious
- the Gyoza was very good too
author: Peter C.

description:
The atmosphere here is calm and quiet (even when my boyfriend and I went on a Saturday evening). The service is amazing, our waitress was really sweet and we didn't feel rushed or interrupted throughout the meal. We took our time and had a quiet and relaxed place to talk. The sushi was good, definitely fresh and had good flavors. They also had a menu of some specials for that night, which were really good- the Red Devil Roll was 3 out of 5 stars, the Burrito roll was 4 out of 5 and I would absolutely go back for the 49ers roll (salmon with lemon slices on top- 5 out of 5 stars). 

Overall, great service, relaxed and casual atmosphere and a worthwhile place to check out.
author: Hannah P.

description: I travel to San Francisco just to have sushi here. Once again, I travel to San Francisco from Southern California just to eat here. Hands down the best sushi I have ever had. I was on a contract with Levi's for 6 months and ate here every week. That was almost 2 years ago and I travel to San Francisco when ever I can just to eat here. The quality of the fish is second to none. When I eat here I just tell the chef to serve omakase (means "I trust you") but if you are not that trusting try the Aji and the sunomono salad. Absolutely mind blowing experience every time. The waitress (wife) and chef (husband) and so warm and welcoming. If you are looking for cheap sushi and a dushe bag atmosphere this is not the place for you, go somewhere else. If you are looking for amazing sushi and authentic atmosphere look no further.
author: Joseph M.

description:
I rarely put a bad review but this sushi bar is an exception.

It's a night when I took my girl for a walk and sushi. We were going to Zushi bar but that didn't accept walk-in customer at that time so we walked on Lombard and this restaurant looked really nice& warm. Let give it a try I thought.  

Firstly, This place looks nice for couples ;). it has a small private room with two tables that you may feel more comfortable for a dinner with your guy/girl ;).

But its sushi is not that great. It's not fresh. I tried Hamachi, Dragon, Golden Gate and Teriyaki. None of them were great. 

The waitress is friendly enough. But I feel like they forgot about our existence in this planet or maybe they want to leave us for our privacy ;). The food took a long time to come even though the bar is not that crowed. Or maybe they take time to make food for customer on the bar. I don't know. 

Their green tea ice cream tastes good also.
We planned to grab some drink after this it took so long to finish the meal and we end up coming home. 

btw, I must say this is nice place, nice people. I just hope the food was much better than.
author: Vinh N.

description:
Stumbled upon this place by accident when Zushi Puzzle was overbooked, luckily it was only 2 blocks away and there was only one other group of 2 eating at the restaurant when we walked in.  

The server was very nice and brought us drinks while we waited for the rest of our group.  We started with 12 oysters which were okay, a few had a very faint off flavor but for the most part they were solid.  We moved on to the main course and I sampled a variety of the nigiri sushi which was all very good and fresh.  We also ordered live scallop which was absolutely delicious.  

Fast forward through a few rolls and I was very satisfied!  Great sushi spot with very nice servers and reasonably priced.  I will definitely be back here when I want good sushi but am trying to avoid breaking the bank!
author: Ryan J.

description: Freshest sushi ever!!  Wow, this stuff was good.  The woman who works here told us once we were seated that they didn't offer their dinner menu, mostly just sushi and appetizers, which was fine with us.  My friend got an incredibly fresh-looking ahi tuna salad, I got the rock n roll (eel avocado) and burrito roll (which had spicy salmon and shrimp I think... Wrapped in a flour tortilla).  Husband had 49ers roll with salmon wrapped around avocado roll with lemon on top (something I've never seen on sushi - lemon)!!  Everything was really delicious and incredibly fresh.  It seemed like other people in the restaurant were all regulars and knew the owners already.  Highly recommend this place if you are in the area!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
best sushi ! fresh, thoughtful, delicious! wonderful, attentive staff. 

not cheap, but well worth what you pay for!

we leave happy every time!

cheers
author: Vanessa M.

description:
I have lived in SF for almost three years now and have eaten at just about every hot sushi restaurant in the city. Atami sushi is the BEST I have had, anywhere.  It is family run and can sometimes be a little slow, but it is well worth the wait. The fish is the freshest you will find and each of the rolls are carefully crafted by the owner, Wiley. You can tell he puts time and heart into each roll he makes. I would recommend calling in your order if you are in a hurry. Though I have not been disappointed by anything I have ordered here, a few of my favorites are: 

- Blue Hawaii
- 49er Roll
- Tokyo Tower
- Marina Roll
author: Ashley L.

description: Great sushi. Bad service from manager. Waited 15 min for water refill. Asked repeatedly. Manger cleared a table and took an order. I asked again. No water. This time my mouth was on fire after a spicy tuna roll. I was forced to go to the bathroom to refill my water?? I was told to be patient. I thought 15 min of dry mouth waiting for water was patient. Owner/waitress refused to address my issues. Turned my Sat night into a miserable experience.
author: Tarra C.

description: Overpriced, warm fish, small rolls, stingy with fish portion. Not deserving of 4 stars.
author: Joel L.

description: My favorite neighborhood Resuraunt in the city. Always super fresh fish. Excellent service
author: Ohhh Y.

description:
Came to this place due to yelp recommendations. We had the Hurricane roll which was pretty good. It was a spicy tuna based roll with tempura crunch and topped with albacore and green onion. I had the chirashi like I usually do with all new Japanese/Sushi restaurants I go to - it is how I judge their quality of sushi. Afterall chirashi (scattered sashimi on top of sushi rice) is essentially a giant piece of sushi! 

Sad to say, the chirashi was a bit of a disappointment. There was not that much sashimi on top and the rice was quite warm/hot. Big mistakes in my book. I'm used to chirashi bowls so overfilled with an assortment of fish that I don't know where to put it all so I can get to my nice cool/cold sushi rice. The rice was warm/hot which warmed my sashimi pieces to an unpleasant lukewarm temperature. There was not enough fish. Also, service was slow. 

Parking is also very tricky! Sharp turn in a moderately trafficked street (Lombard) with little room to maneuver. 

There are so many better places in the city to go to. I probably won't be returning here.
author: Tracy N.

description:
Ok.....so I have not been back for about a year due to schedule and the growing restaurants and night life in Oakland. 

I went with a lady friend who loves sushi as much as I do. We were in the area so I thought about calling to make sure they were still open on a Tuesday night about 9 PM. I hear Michelle's voice and told her who I was and she clearly remembers me and mentions she missed my presence. That was very welcoming since this is one of my favorite place for sushi in the world.. 

When I arrived through the back a nice warm hug from her was very nice because it always felt like family dining. When I called, I had already pre-ordered. I HAVE TO SAY.........THE GARLIC ALBACORE IS A MUST TRY! IT HAS BEEN VERY CONSISTENT FOR ALMOST 10 YEARS. Even after a one year break from this place, IT STILL MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH! I missed going there. 

Of course, the customer service is always up to par! I love this place because it is family ran and you can always tell by the neighboring customer's that comes here as a second kitchen home. 

I will NOT go another year with out going again!
author: ARIeL P.

description: Very good sushi but seriously let down by incredibly slow food delivery.
author: Nick K.

description:
Red devil & dragon rolls are phenomenal. So is the sake sashimi. 

Hidden gem. Very clean, and wonderful service. I'll be back!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Visiting from out of two and found is place on Yelp!  What a great place.
It was a small hole in the wall and was just what we were looking for.  I'd highly recommend.
author: D M.

description:
Cute little mom & pop place to grab a bite.  The place has potential for 4 stars though - I plan to come back soon and re-evaluate :) It's so close to my place, I think I could become a regular!

I ordered zaru soba (noodles were chewy...different than I've had before, but not neccessarily a bad thing), red devil roll (every other piece was really good, alternating with slightly off what i wanted...maybe it was the salmon which is not my fave), oshitashi (it's just boiled spinach - i need my veggies!), and MOCHI (standard mochi, but I love it nonetheless).
author: Priscilla T.

description: Wiley does an excellent job of sushi and sashimi. Michelle is a very sweet lady. Plus free parking for dinner... in the Marina!
author: Harold H.

description:
One of the best hidden treasures in SF. I've been going there for over ten years and have yet to be disappointed. If you're looking for the atmosphere of a Mas Sake, move on. If you're looking for some of the freshest fish in the city, then Atami is a must to experience. 

A small family run business, Michelle makes you feel at home and Wiley prepares perfection. I've been going there long enough to be greeted by name and always feel special with gracious service and a warm atmosphere. The traditional rolls are amazing and Wiley dazzles with some of his own unique creation.

Pay them a visit if you're in the hood!
author: Seth M.

description:
Really fresh sushi. Not the cheapest or quickest meal ever, but the quality of the food was up there with the best of SF. The restaurant is small and quiet. I think there was only one lady taking orders and one sushi chef, so the meal was sort of long though there were only three couples dining in the restaurant.

$48 (including tip) scored us one bowl of udon, one order of butterfish nigiri (special), one burrito roll (special) and one blue Hawaii roll (special). Each item came out separately. The butterfish was cold, delicate and fresh, the way it should be. The udon came out next. The broth was perfect; not overly salty yet not boring nor bland. The burrito roll was wrapped in rice paper and filled with blue fin tuna, maguro and avocado. Good, but I liked the blue Hawaii roll better which was blue fin tuna and avocado wrapped in either albacore or hamachi, I can't remember.

We were in the neighborhood hungry for sushi yesterday, and Umami and Yuzu (both of which I've bookmarked and am waiting patiently to try) were both closed for the holiday weekend, so we opted for Atami. Excellent sushi, so slow service aside, I think I would come back.
author: Chelsea P.

description: Fish was fresh! Love the spicy scallop roll! Uni and ankimo was amazing! Friendly service! Will definitely come back! :)
author: Bonnie Y.

description: Nice place for a date. The atmosphere is great for talking and eating really good food. We had the dragon, shrimp, golden gate and the red hawk which all were delicious. Definitely have to try if you are in the mood for sushi!
author: Jose H.

description:
This sushi place is not bad, but way way overpriced. The fish is good, but not good value. You are better off going to Zushi Puzzle where you get high quality fish plus plentiful portions that justify the price. I paid $48 for a sashimi combo (which was 10 small pieces of fish and did not come with soup or salad) + 1 kamikaze roll (which did not match the description on the menu - there was regular maguro not shiro maguro on the outside) + 1 rainbow roll w/ fake crab. Considering the price tag, my BF and I expected at least to get big rolls, even if the sashimi pieces were small. But the rolls were only six pieces each and not much bigger than a standard spicy tuna roll elsewhere. I had high hopes for this place, but was very disappointed based on the quality-price trade-off. 

Bottom line: Not bad, but you could do better for the price elsewhere.
author: Blond E.

description:
My boyfriend and I were looking for a nice sushi place to eat on blustery San Francisco evening and we ended up stumbling into Atami. It really was a pleasant surprise. The fish was very fresh (great Uni), the service kind and quick. The place was quiet and intimate which is what we were looking for, and the entrance way (with paved stones meant to look like a traditional japanese home.. or at least thats what I thought). 

Bottom line: quiet, not to hip, but great fish and service.
author: corinne o.

description:
I would have given this place a 3.5-4 star review but once we got in the car and I asked my partner what he thought, he said his experience was a 1 star and I was shocked.  Then he broke it down for me and I realized that I was influenced by my extreme ravenous hunger and my post-yoga high and he was right, the food was sub-par.

I started with the green salad which was tasty with a light lemony dressing but it was tiny. I think it costs 6 or 7 bucks but it is about a small handful of mixed greens and 1 small cherry tomato cut in half. 

I ordered two rolls but dont really remember what they were, other than the fact that the fish in one had a lot connective tissue and it was a bit gross looking and the tuna on the outside was room temp and sort of fishy tasting. 
The rolls are priced about 9-12 bucks but are also very small. 
My partner also ordered soba noodles and some tempura.  I think this is what made him so unhappy with the meal...the noodles were so bland, zero flavor, and the tempura was very greasy and looked like marshmallow...not flaky, it was cakey.

There were three of us and I dont know about our friend, but the two of us went home semi-hungry after spending about $85 including tip.

The things I loved about this place are the comfortable decor, the family-owned atmosphere, the friendly service.  I feel awful giving them a 2 star review...I wish I could be more generous but rating the food on its own merit, I cant be.
author: Nilu r.

description: This mom and pop sushi restaurant has the most delicious sushi.  Everything is fresh, proportioned well, and the flavors are spot on.  Because it is small, the service, while good and with a smile, is a bit on the slower side, but if you aren't in a rush, the food makes up for it and the owners couldn't be nicer.
author: Julia B.

description: A hidden gem in the Marina. Small restaurant with fresh, awesome sushi rolls. Love the Burrito Roll especially!
author: Nipul C.

description:
small, family owned sushi restaurant  (all the staff are super friendly and welcoming) and OH SO DELICIOUS! all their rolls are made to perfection and most importantly..... THE FISH IS FRESH! it is a tad bit on the pricey side however i would rather pay a few bucks more than hang around the toilet all night :x JUST SAYING! 

HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
We came here because it was right next to our motel.
The sushi was hella fresh. 
Even though the chefs need to rim me (just because we're not white doesn't give you an excuse to forget your sense of decorum), the expertly crafted rolls were good.
We stuck out like tourists because everyone there seemed like regulars.

The prices are pretty steep but we didn't trip about it, B!!
author: Rico A.

description:
Delicious fish. My god. The tuna rolls were fantastic -- spicy tuna topped with ahi tuna. Ahi tuna wrapped in yellowtail. Melt-in-your-mouth cuts of fish. I actually regret not just ordering a shiteload of sashimi, coz I think that would've been the way to go. 

But, the prices are only $$ for the Marina, and the service is merely adequate -- I got there pretty late on a Saturday and even though my crew was at one of three occupied tables in the joint it took forever for food and check to arrive. Then again, I've never eaten at a good sushi place that also had excellent service. A clinical trial should be conducted.
author: Sydni F.

description:
Super hit and miss place.

The Aji today was just aweful.  I mean needed a chaser aweful.
The decor is farily traditional but the menu and preparation are not.

Given the inconsistency in fish quality I would not expect this place to have consistantly good food from one day to the next.

Oddly the Uni was great but hamachi and Aji were not.

I wouldnt't come here again but if you are in the area, enjoy sushi from boats, or need to empress some marinite or cow hollow date this place might be safe.
author: Spanky M.

description:
My family and I tried to go to Zushi Puzzle (right down the road), but were turned away because we did not have a reservation. So, we turned around and went to Atami. After the delicious meal we had, we found it really hard to believe that Zushi Puzzle could have been any better.
Atami is a small place with unique sushi rolls and very gracious hosts. Out of the eight rolls we tried, there was not a bad one. The spider roll was especially good!
author: Elyse P.

description:
I don't like to review a restaurant based upon one meal, BUT this place needs help. The husband and wife that own and operate it are very nice, but the cuisine needs an infusion of talent.
They should hire someone fresh from Japan and make him a partner.
author: Drew S.

description: Awesome food, weirdly slow service. Curious to go back at a different time and see if it gets better.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Everything about this place is great - from the food to the service to the complimentary parking in the back to the atmosphere. 

I came here with my folks for some solid sushi. We had salmon nigiri, spicy scallop nigiri, tobiko nigiri, octopus, atomi yummy roll, the kamikaze roll, deep fried tofu, and the seaweed salad. Everything was A-mazing. Super fresh and melts in your mouth. (i didn't like the scallop nigiri but it might be an acquired taste?). 

The service is beyond friendly and polite. Completely on par. 

The atmosphere is fab because it's hidden away so it's not just everyone off the street stopping in. It's very cozy without feeling stuffy. 

The one thing this place doesn't have is crazy inventive rolls but that's quiet alright with me. This place has a very traditional sushi joint vibe so if you want good quality sushi this is the place for you. 

Yum.
author: Sasha B.

description: Make sure you have about 3 hours to order a few rolls before you come here--the service is SO SLOW.  The sushi is good, but it's hard to know if it is really superior, or if you are just so hungry by the time your food FINALLY gets to you that anything would taste good at that point.  The sushi is at least 4 star, but the service is so slow that you might as well fly to Fiji, learn to spear fish, and do it yourself.
author: E P.

description: get the burrito roll, it's amazing! and the 49er roll. The couple that owns the restaurant are so nice and the food is incredible!
author: Lisa A.

description: I wasn't a sushi snob until I came to Atami sushi because before, I did not really know what good sushi was. I thought it was all pretty good, but Atami sushi blew me away when the sushi melted like chocolate in my mouth. We came in before closing,  but the staff was still kind and willing to box something up for us. We really appreciated that we ordered 2 rolls and he efficiently packaged them together- we liked that the chef was conscious of waste. The restaurant is cozy and intimate, but not stuffy. There is also a little room that you can get closed off for a private dining experience. Yum so good now I know what good sushi is.
author: Chelsea H.

description:
It makes me sad to see that 3 stars is labeled as "A-OK" on Yelp because this place was better than A-OK. However, I don't wanna give it a 4-star "Yay! I'm a Fan!" because of a few things. --- I'd like to quote Fred S. (down below on this page) who phrased it perfectly: "If this restaurant were in another city, I'd go back, but in SF, I'll keep trying."

First, I'll start with the positives: 
Very fresh fish. 
My boyfriend and I started with the spicy tuna roll, which was the usual mashed tuna (not whole pieces, like some people prefer). Very tasty tuna though. You could tell it's not because they had bad quality fish that they mashed it. 
Then came the caterpillar roll. The unagi was inside with some very finely chopped cucumbers and the avocados were on top. This was way better than standard caterpillar rolls. The unagi melts in your mouth while the fresh, crunchy cucumber adds the perfect texture.
