Then we had the spider roll. This was good, but my least favorite. 

Because that wasn't enough (refer to the negatives below), especially for my boyfriend, he ordered tonkatsu and I got a saba nigiri. 

Saba nigiri is a good indicator of whether the restaurant has good fish or not. Atami passes! Yummyyy! It melted in my mouth and wasn't overly fishy. Perfect. 
 
The tonkatsu was really good too. It was almost as good as my mom makes it-- I have never had tonkatsu as good as my mom's at a restaurant. It's always either too thin, and thus too crispy/hard, or they use the bad part of the meat that's stringy or fat-heavy. This was the right thickness and the right amount of breading. :) Props to them for getting this right. 

The negatives:
The only negative is the small portion! Usually, one roll is enough for me. Ok, maybe 1.5. It's probably fair considering how good they are, but I'm just not used to having to pay so much for sushi (in America). 
When the seaweed salad came, it was the smallest portion of seaweed salad I have ever had. I thought, well, the rolls may be different. When spicy tuna ($6) came, I thought it was just small because it was one of the non-special rolls. When the caterpillar roll ($10) came and it was also... tiny, I was sad :(  The only thing that was the same size as other places I've been to was the tonkatsu ($13.95). 

I would choose quality over quantity when it comes to sushi, but there's gotta be a place that serves just a liiiitle bit more. IF YOU CAN AFFORD IT, GO HERE! THE FOOD IS GREAT!

No more negatives. The waitress here was really sweet, and the chefs looked friendly too. The place is really clean and has quite an "authentic" Japanese look to it.
author: Saori E.

description:
Unfortunately, after $125 for 2 people here, I found out this place is not really a 4 star worthy place.

Rice is so overcooked it's beyond sticky. The fish is decently fresh, but you should never accept anything less, right? It really does not live up to the name of the beautiful sea food city of Atami in Shizuoka, Japan. $125 in Atami you would have the best fish you've ever tasted in your entire life.

Decor is pretty nice. They put an effort into providing a good service.

I would not go back here again.
author: Kokoro I.

description:
The fish is very fresh and if you're not in the mood for Sushi try the Soba noodles or donburi.

This is one of my favorites in the city and the service is very personal, sitting at the bar is fun. I live right in the area (that's how I found out about it) and am moving to another neighborhood.. but I'll be back!!
author: Nick H.

description: Went to Atami again tonight and brought friends who are now big fans. Always love the red devil and Atami Yummy.
author: Beth L.

description:
Really good, fresh tasting sushi.  The special rolls are the best.  Wish it was slightly more affordable, but hard to find good sushi for a good price in SF.  I'd definitely go back.  

The people who worked their were very nice and understanding about our big (and loud) party.
author: Jill G.

description: Our go to to place.  The fish is super fresh and the specials are incredible.  The Big Eye, Blue Hawaii, and Red Devil are our personal favorites but you really can't go wrong.
author: Dermot M.

description: Yikes, was hoping it would be at least decent. Granted we ordered take out but it was super expensive and every roll tasted the same.
author: Susie T.

description:
After living in Costa RIca for a year and a half, I decided to visit my old hood in the Marina. Of course, I had to hit-up my 5-fav's before I was on my Peru. And of course one of them is Atami Sushi!!! 

Antami not only has some of the best Sushi in San Francisco, but the little Japanese lady that works there remembered me and asked me all about my travels. My friends from Costa Rica and San Francisco couldn't believe it. Talk about great service. 

Remember: This place is not fancy or hip and it's not popin like Ace Wasabi's Rock 'n' Roll Sushi, but that is obvious given it sits along Lombard Street with glowing purple neon lights. I suggest you don't judge a book by it's cover and just dig in.
author: Laura S.

description:
When I'm in San Francisco, especially when staying nearby, Atami is my first stop after I unpack my luggage.

There is something wonderfully simple and charming about this neighborhood sushi joint and I know I have my pick of sushi places in SF.

I could expound endlessly about the details but Atami is just a great, reliable sushi restaurant. The atmosphere is far from stuffy. You will feel welcome from the moment you cross the threshold. Sit at the bar or at a table and you will have a great experience.
author: Jerzy G.

description: The food here is good. The fish is really fresh. But the reason they're getting only 3 stars is that the server's attitude was crummy. We ate here with 3 kids, and immediately her tone was noticeably sour with us, though pretty friendly/smiley with everyone else. It was disappointing because we have been to Atami several times before with friendly service from her and her son. Tonight we brought out of town guests, excited to take them to our favorite neighborhood sushi joint, and it was embarrassing that our server was so visibly irritated with our existence. It makes me not want to come back, even without any kids.
author: Monica T.

description:
The verdict is in, after multiple visits: Inept service obliterates what could have been a terrific place.  Husband makes sushi, Wife serves tables.  Her maniacal grin and saccharine pleasantries belie her absolutely awful service.  Be prepared to wait and wait, and for her to forget and forget.  Too lazy to move at a decent pace, to cheap to hire a server, lady, you have ruined this place.
*This is one of the many Chinese sushi places in the City.
author: Peter V.

description:
I love this spot. Between the really fresh fish and the sweet owners, this place has become a regular part of my sushi repertoire.

Their menu is basic, so think quality, not quantity - they don't have the rolls with a million ingredients.  But all the fish is fresh and delicious. The service is great and the atmosphere is really relaxing - a great mid-week spot.
author: Gretchen S.

description: Yum. Shared the Rainbow Roll and Crazy Roll with a friend. The rolls are tiny but have a lot of flavor, so it was definitely worth it. Pretty decorations too.
author: Chelsea N.

description:
The Reason I was in San Francisco: YouTube Live..

Last minute planning and a very controlled budget led me to stay at Town House Motel- Just INCHES away from this sushi joint. It was a Saturday night and my friend and I were exhausted so we decided to walk around the corner to this little sushi bar.

I've had Sushi in many places and this little hidden place is pretty par with many places I have been. When ever I go to a new sushi place besides checking out the prices, I check what they have to offer. Very moderately priced I decided to try out a few things, a couple hand rolls, some sushi rolls, appetizers, some baked rolls, the whole nine.

What I liked is that that all of the fish I tasted was very fresh, and the sushi chef -because I was at the bar- was very catering to my needs. 

Overall it was a great round the corner spot, that is small and quiet, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: Melvin F.

description: My new favorite neighborhood sushi restaurant. The fish is quality and fresh. The staff is friendly and attentive. And the atmosphere is simple and quiet. I can't recall the name of it, but there's a roll with butter fish on top that's absolutely delicious. It really does melt in your mouth!
author: Susan S.

description: Seriously amazing. People who have anything bad to say about this spot have poor taste in sushi. The Red Devil and the Blue Moon were incredible. Very lite rice and tons of fish. The butter fish literally melts in your mouth. The place is little, quiet and mellow. Such a nice change of pace from the typical scene.
author: Jacqueline M.

description: Great food always feel like there heads are going to explode with how they are.
author: Khalid M.

description:
It helps that this place is only 4 blocks away from my house.  Walking over there with one roomie and three dogs makes 4 blocks a little bit more difficult then you would think but never the less after stopping at every last little bush or piece of green making its way up from the cement we made it.    I was in charge of ordering... first mistake.. I always ALWAYS order way to much food.  I just don't like to see people go hungry...  Probably should have remembered that only two people were eating and that the dogs already had dinner.    oops...   

After ordering my food TO GO. (and by the way this place is super small with one guy rolling out the sushi...) It took nearly 45 minutes before I was able to pay for an inordinate amount of food.  You would think that with someone obviously buying alot of sushi they would want to make you a happy sushi goer and get you out of there fast so that you will come back...  hmmm...  Well they didn't and even though I must admit the Udon Soup was YUMMY!!! and the Sake Nigiri (the salmon on a rice square for those that don't know sushi terms) was really fresh and good I was not impressed with the rest.  Will I go back? Probably for the soup.  Just be prepared to call ahead with a take out order and know that if you go and eat there only one man will be rolling out the sushi and there might be a wait.. but that is what sake is for right? (so only three stars is because of the wait.. sorry guys)
author: Kylie L.

description:
I've visited Atami 3 times in the past year and I like it. 

It has a real mom and pop feel, which is a much better way to enjoy sushi than at the rock-and-roll sushi dumps that are all the rage, and have been since 1999. 

1999 wasn't that cool to begin with, why are we sticking with this shitty formula. 

Atami keep doing what you're doing. You're all right with me.
author: Jason R.

description: Atami rocks! - my pick for sushi in the marina (and I think my wife and I have tried most of them). And this says it all for me - they DO NOT USE MAYONNAISE. Wow - legit (what exactly is with all these hacks around the City who will happily throw a big dollop of mayo on or in your sushi rolls). The chef at Atami does not HAVE any mayo. Nice - good start. Great sushi, good service and a very reasonable price ($77 for 3 people no alcohol and we ate lots). A little off the main path - Lombard/Octavia - but worth the hike.
author: Phil L.

description: Ate at Atami while visiting friends in San Francisco. They said it was the place to go for fresh fish and good service. Inside is very small and the night we went, only one woman was waiting tables so it took a while for our food to reach us, but in the end it was worth it. The fish was fresh and flavorful. Definitely going back.
author: Nikki H.

description: Best sushi in SF. It's so fresh and you can tell they make the rice right before they serve the food. Fish is very fresh and every time I have gone, the service has been stellar!
author: Lyndsey M.

description:
This place is simply the very best Japanese restaurant I have ever been to.

The atmosphere is relaxed, welcoming and tastefully appointed.  Polished but not 'over polished'.

The decor is of the authentic Japanese persuasion; not plastic, sterile and cold.

The service is superb.  From greeting to farewell, the entire staff is unobtrusive but tastefully attentive.  Not rushed, I would say.

The sushi is absolutely PHENOMENAL.  I cannot emphasize the good fortune you will feel when you have dined at Atami on Lombard & Octavia.

A must.
author: Michael O.

description:
this place does not deserve a 4.5 star rating, no freaking way.

The fish is good and the rolls are good.  the service we got was real slow, and there were barely any people there for a late thursday night so there was no excuse.  there is nothing unique about this place - neither the ambience, nor the price, nor the selection, nor the service.  it's just another sushi restaurant (JASR).  

5 stars people?  Please.   Let's all make Yelp a better place and be more selective about our 5 star ratings.
author: Matt S.

description: This is a fantastic family run, neighborhood spot.  They're food is delicious.  The owners are lovely people.  Be prepared for a leisurely meal.  This isn't an in and out in 45 minutes kind of place.  They can get really busy at peak times Thurs - Sat.  But the food is absolutely delicious.
author: Jillian M.

description:
I consider myself a sushi-aholic, and this is hands down my favorite sushi spot in San Francisco!  

The scene:  Nothing fancy, rarely a wait, with a comfortable, clean atmosphere.  Only spot in the entire city with a parking lot in the back.  And I dare you to try to go more than once without the owners remembering your name!  Family owned, Michelle and Wiley take care of their customers like no other restaurant I've been to in this city.  

The food:  The sushi is ALWAYS consistently fresh and amazing.  Not too much rice on the rolls, albacore sashimi like butter, and the timing that your food comes out is impeccable....they slowly bring out one roll or dish at a time and actually give you time to digest what you just ate, enjoy the company your with, never rushing you out the door.

It really is the best kept secret in the city.  If you go, tell Michelle I said hi!
author: Holly M.

description:
Went here for my last official dinner in the city of San Francisco and was not disappointed. 

It is a great alternative to all the other sushi places in the Marina (Mas Sake) and has less of a "scene". 

The sushi itself was really tasty and I would recommend the 49'er and Red Devil rolls to anyone. The portions are a little on the small side but it just means you order lots of different types instead of ordering a few big rolls. You can end up spending about ~$30 a person here with sushi and drinks. 

I was afraid that my last dinner in SF might turn out to be a disappointment but Atami came through for my friends and me.
author: Arin N.

description: Went at seven on a Tues night, only one there when I arrived though it got reasonably full soon thereafter. Very attractive place, quiet almost serene. Spotlessly clean and a ret room you can actually turn around in without smashing an elbow. Small but good table spacing, didn't feel at all jammed in. Had non- sushi standards: tempura, miso, and chicken teriyaki, all very good. Service was just fine. Will return soon!
author: Kent L.

description:
Overpriced. The service was acceptable, if a little on the slow side. However we ordered a beef main dish that was essentially a bowl of white rice. We had to ask for more noodles, and received a small bowl of additional plain noodles. 

The best thing we ordered was the ahi tuna sushi special which was quite good. The rest of the sushi was average.

There are much better and cheaper sushi choices in the area.
author: Julian F.

description:
After reading the reviews, I'll admit that my expectation was set pretty high for this sushi joint.  Unfortunately, Atami failed to deliver on those expectations.

I want to start off with the positive aspects of my dining experience:
- waitstaff was polite
- the restaurant was tastefully decorated
- it wasn't overly crowded or noisy
- the restaurant (including the restroom) was clean
- the sushi tasted decent
- there were a large number of specials and choices available for diners

Unfortunately, because of the following, I will not be heading back to Atami:

- the portion size is MINISCULE
- we didn't get timely refills on the water or ocha
- where was the FISH?  (very thinly sliced)
- the first time that I called and left a message inquiring about driving directions to the joint & parking - NO ONE CALLED ME BACK.
- the price...$38.00, not including tip and I left HUNGRY....

Sorry, I must disagree with the other yelpers giving this place rave reviews.  The staff are nice and the fish (the small slices) seemed fresh, but the experience was not super enjoyable for either my boyfriend or myself.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Pretty decent sushi for a decent price. Their rolls aren't huge - which I like - ordered the Hurricane roll that had little crispy bits of tempura in it - yummy, fresh and crunchy. We ordered mostly nigiri and all the fish was really fresh. Edamame, soup, 2 rolls, 6-8 pieces of nigiri and 2 beers came to less than $30 each. Service was good and atmosphere was ok - Monday night was pretty quiet. I'd say Atami is great for what it is - neighborhood place, decent quality, affordable, comfortable, standard, etc. 

Still searching for that totally kick ass sushi place that I crave uncontrollably. Haven't found it yet...
author: Kate S.

description:
My roommate and I LOVE Atami!  It's small and quiet, never crowded!  The service is great and friendly.  All of the sushi rolls are delicious, especially the specials.  They don't do anything too crazy or non-traditional, but everything tastes great and it's very reasonably priced!

...I'm editing my review above and docking Atami one star.  The service has started suffering a bit lately.  There is only one waitperson, and while she is very friendly and helpful, she is also extremely slow.  I still love coming here, but only when I have plenty of time.
author: Erin G.

description: The food was really good but the quantities were really small for the price you pay. Too costly for what it was
author: Nabila A.

description:
You live long enough and eventually you will see it all...Yes, a very good sushi restaurant run by a Chinese-Vietnamese family in the Marina.  I used to tell my friends categorically to NEVER EVER eat sushi at a restaurant run by Chinese owners but now I'm the one eating crow.

The sushi chef is a true professional and carries a good selection of fresh fish.  We ate like crazy and spent about a $100.  Not bad, not bad at all.  Atami is now on my regular list.  My only criticism and it is a slight one is that I like my rice with a little more vinegar but I think that is a little more personal taste than anything.

My next endeavor is to find a good Pho' restaurant run by a Japanese...
author: Laurence H.

description:
For a Saturday night, Atami wasn't very crowded, and therefore our food came out at the perfect pace. The service was pleasent and we didn't have to wait for a table, surpisingly. 

Most of the rolls we tried were REALLY small and just average in taste, the only stand out was the Ahi-Ahi roll. Two different kinds of tuna with tempura flakes. Really good. We tried the Hamachi nigiri which was average, pretty much sums up the restaurant.. Average.
author: Sara D.

description: A solid mom-n-pop Japanese spot in the Marina/Cow Hollow area. Their selection is not quite as large as some of their local competitors, however, it's a quiet spot and a nice diversion from some of the trendier ones nearby. You will enjoy quality fresh fish, efficient service and you will eat in peace.
author: Meredith R.

description: We tried this place because it was nearby and had great ratings. The service is friendly, but the rolls are much smaller than what I'm used to. The rainbow roll is generally my favorite stand-by wherever I go, but I was disappointed at how small the 6 pieces were and unimpressed with the seafood. We'll probably try a new place next time.
author: Gloria C.

description: Best 49'ers roll in town! Very fresh fish! Very friendly owners:) My favorite place in town for sushi
author: Sveta K.

description:
This place is great so far, just moved in a block away and I've only been once... but had a great experience. Super quiet setting.. we got there a little early and there was just one couple sitting at the bar so my expectations were low... but the place started filling up quickly and the first roll made me an instant fan. Super fresh fish, the seared amberjack sashimi on the Blue Moon roll melted in my mouth like butter.. I could eat 10 of those rolls and come back for more. Service was friendly and fast. The large hot sake was both large and hot.

My only (minor) gripe is that the rolls are small and the prices kind of steep considering that. But really, I don't mind paying for quality...
author: Blake D.

description:
Had a great dinner here on a Saturday night. We made reservations but they weren't needed since it wasn't too crowded. 

We had the seaweed salad, poki salad, seafood udon, hamachi nigiri, uni nigiri, tokyo tower roll, rainbow roll, and elegant roll. Everything was quite delicious and SUPER fresh! 

Make sure to check out the specials board sitting next to the sushi bar, we missed that before we ordered so now we have another reason to come back!

For the Yelpers that say the rolls are "too small", that's actually how big they SHOULD be! You're just used to gross, overdone Americanized "specialty rolls". Each piece of sushi should actually easily fit into your mouth. If you practically need to unhinge your jaw to get a sushi piece in, it's not authentic. 

Took away 1 star since the food came out pretty slowly when the place wasn't even busy. However, there *is* just 1 chef, so that's probably why.

Oh, and parking sucks.
author: Jen P.

description:
What a nice surprise! Decided late last night (on a Friday) i wanted to sit and have some delicious sushi. Now i live right around the block from Zushi Puzzle, and can a place really ever be busier than that one? So I hop on yelp and try to find another joint to get good, fresh sushi without having to deal with long lines and "the scene".  Here's where Atami comes in.

Off Lombard, which totally sucks for the restaurant for walk-in traffic, but good for people that don't like crowds. Small inside but there was room for us at 8:30p on a Friday (2 of us). We got the sashimi combination, miso soup and shrimp and veggie tempura. All was very fresh and really very good. The fish especially was great, you can't hide anything when you do it sashimi style and I was not disappointed (to address other reviews it is on the smaller portion size but not enough to make me really that upset). The tempura was nice and light, not greasy at all. Total was $45 (we also shared a large beer). Pretty much what i was expecting price wise. 

Zushi is still my favorite as they have more choices and sometimes rarer fish options (Atami had the regular choices), but when I don't get my act together early enough to put in reservations for Zushi, I'll definitely be back to Atami.
author: Sarah G.

description:
We've been here several more times since our first visit last april and we've been served consistently good fish. The tobiko with quail egg was extra delicious tonight.

Service is always so friendly and inviting. If the restaurant is full, we prefer to sit at the bar as the sushi seems to come out quicker.

And for you AmExers out there, they recently started accepting american express.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Best. Sushi. Period. 
Owners are gems. 
I dare anyone to find better sushi!
author: Slut G.

description:
We love this sushi restaurant. Particularly the soy paper wrapped spicy tuna hand roll.  

We have gone there since before our daughter was born and after. Michelle is the waitress and she is so patient & kind whenever we come in. There are a couple of high chairs but we usually bring ours that attaches to the table, just in-case. It's nice to see other families there as well.
author: Jolene L.

description: Best sushi restaurant in SF.  Owners are so nice. Sushi is great quality and the rolls are the best. Love the Red Devil
author: Mike S.

description: Amazing sushi. It's a small family-owned operation, and michelle and wylee make you feel at home. This was my go-to for 4 years in the city.
author: Franco T.

description:
Fish: Good. Well cut, but just so-so.
Servings: Average/Traditional Japanese style.
Price: Average - rolls were small, but well crafted.
Ambience: OK, could have done without the TV - made it seem like a sports bar.

Friendly owners and staff, but overall, would easily go back, just not much to write home about. I took off one star because when I sit at a sushi bar, I like to chat with the chef. Not much conversation tonight, perhaps it was the phase of the moon. Will try again.
author: J Z.

description: Convenience factor is high for me.  I can roll out of my apartment and be here having sushi in 10 minutes WITHOUT a reservation - thats big in San Francisco.  I had dinner here Friday night.  We strolled in a little after 8 and were immediately seated by the sweet waitress.  Everything we had as top notch.  From the miso soup to the specialty rolls!  The fish was fresh & plentiful and completely satisfying.  I loved the small, comfortable restaurant with its lively nature.  Most of the seats + sushi bar was full and everyone seemed totally happy.  Great dinner and I will be back!
author: Tiffany L.

description: Quaint place with good sushi. Our favorite was a spider roll. Prices were higher, and portions smaller, than expected.
author: Karen R.

description:
Atami, hands down, of the numerous places I've tried, is the best sushi in San Francisco.   Very clean, sharp attention to detail and amazing presentation are all complimented by the personal and friendly service.  As someone who is not very adventurous when it comes to fish, Atami is the ONE location where I will try any dish, from Rolls to Sashimi.  Very fresh food and always served with a smile.  A must try.  Of all the sushi restaurants in SF this is the best.
If you're looking for a hip trendy spot, this is not it.  The music is soft and the lighting gentle so you can see and hear the people you're with.  It's not a fast food joint so don't expect to get in and out in 20 minutes.  Sit back, relax and ENJOY! :-D
If I could give this place 10 stars I would!
author: Buster K.

description:
Atami, Japan is a hot-spring resort area, tucked away in middle of the countryside.  You won't know it unless you are looking for it... 

Atami, San Francisco is a small mom-and-pop sushi joint, obscure on busy Lombard.  Parking sucks.  Traffic can be a little hectic.  But this little hidden sushi joint is definitely worth a try.  

Excellent quality sushi.  A good selection of raw and cooked rolls. Unpretentious price.  Best of all, this place does not even scream "Marina" like Ace Wasabi's or other fancy-looking joints around that you need to dress up to get decent service.  Definitely substance over form.
author: Shirley F.

description:
This is our local japanese place. We go down there for our regular japanese food fix, and it never fails to please.
I usually get the Katsu Don or the Beef Teriyaki, and wash them down with a cold Asahi.... is there anything better for under $20?
I'm not a big sushi fan, but my girlfriend is, and she always enjoys it. I do like the tuna sashimi, and its always fresh.
The miso soup is good.
Friendly "mom and pop" service. Never gets too crowded, so usually no waiting.
author: David H.

description:
This is our second favorite sushi place in the city.
The staff are amazing and friendly.
Make sure and try some of their specialty rolls.
author: Victoria J.

description:
The fish was amazing and the service was quite good. All of the special rolls were great as well, especially those involving shrimp tempura on the inside and fish on top (i forgot the names, but it should be easy enough to figure out). 

For some reason, we were just about the only people in there on a saturday evening, which was strange given how good it was. 

If there were any downsides, it would be that the portions were perhaps a little small, so if you're on a fish demolition mission you may run up a big bill. (The three of us took down about $130 worth of delicious fish, but we certainly were not there to fool around). If you're looking for a modest meal though, and don't want to wait a long time to get it, this is the spot.
author: Dan M.

description:
Went here with my parents when they were in the city visiting. We sat at the sushi bar and had a great time. Some highlights: all the staff speak and understand english, including the chef. The service is adequate, as well as the atmosphere. The menus include descriptions in english.

It was my first time here and using the night as a reference, I would highly suggest NOT to go on a busy night. Friday nights would probably be the worst time to go. There was only one chef making everything and he got busy very quickly. Towards the end of the night the restaurant wasn't even full and all the staff were swamped, especially the chef. We were at the sushi bar and he couldn't interact with us because he was so busy. It took over an hour for me to get my order. It was most unfortunate because I believe on a better night this place would have scored all 5 stars.
author: Joshua G.

description:
Great Sushi, service, and atmosphere.  Quiet little sushi place, not too crowded, yet has amazing rolls.  I was so impressed with each of the 4 rolls we ordered. A little pricier than I like to pay ($11/roll) but well worth it.  

We will definitely be going back.
author: Lauren M.

description: What a great find!  Impeccable sushi, fresh, and many unique rolls with wonderful medley of flavors. Family owned and impeccable attention to detail.  Try weekdays for a quiet personalized treat.  Private room in the back for your group.
author: Jerome B.

description: Delicious food. A nice place on the cozier side, but also on the expensive side if you figure in the size of the rolls you get. I ordered a Red Devil, and a Crazy roll and while enjoying them both, neither filled me up. I would have expected more with a 4 star rating.
author: Jason R.

description:
a great find just a stone's throw away (and thank goodness) from the crazy hubbub that is the marina. atami is immaculately clean, serene, and delivers on some seriously fresh (albeit teeny portion) sushi and sashimi.

my bf and i shared a chirashi and two sushi rolls (a caterpillar and something else off the special menu), which was just the right amount of food. it came out to about $50 (eek) but it really satiated my sushi cravings that night. yay!
author: Andrey C.

description:
After passing 4 sushi places on my way to Atami, my dining companions wondered why we were walking so far.  I pass by this place on a daily basis, but have never made the trek to see what it's all about.  I've read the yelp reviews and wondered if I could really trust any of the ratings anymore.

The Glowing neon from the "Atami" logo signals you are close to your awaiting sushi adventure.  The entryway has well groomed plants and clean lines which reflects the interior.  This is not like most of the other joints on Lombard where you find a funky canopy and dirty flower boxes.  

Upon a 9 o'clock entry on Saturday night, the place was jam packed with only 2 open spots at the sushi bar (I believe there are 5 or 6 seats at the bar).  Normally, I prefer to sit at the bar to see the sushi chef work their magic.  With 3 people total, a table was a more viable option.  Once the hostess/waitress got around to us, she offered a table or bar seat.  Apparently we overlooked the fact that somebody had actually left and there really were 3 seats.  Score!

Since the place was bursting at the seams, we had to wait to get anything.  It didn't help not knowing what we wanted, although edamame, beer, and sake were standard sushi necessities.  Once we got down to ordering, things flowed smoothly.  Rolls to get:  Dragon roll and the Burrito roll.  We had two other rolls, but I can't remember the names.  My dining companions appeared to like them a lot, whereas I was preferring the burrito roll.  Note, the burrito roll has a non-seaweed wrapper which makes it stick out.  All of the fish we sampled was excellent.  I particularly liked the white tuna out of everything (torro, big red, yellowtail, jack fish).

I can't say if the place has a great sake list, as we never got to see one.  I'd be interested to see what options we might have had.  Maybe next time when I go back.  

Highlights:  fresh fish, a few really well done rolls, excellent service (everybody seems to know Michelle!)

I'd say yelp has come through on this one.  The place has great sashimi and rolls.
author: Simon Y.

description:
This is a great sushi bar, great prices and no attitude. It is run by a sweet couple Wiley and Michelle. They always say hello and are grateful  to have you there. The place is usually full but there is always that one table free so you never have to wait. 

I suggest the poki salad.
author: Joe A.

description:
I am a great sushi lover and I've heard SF has the best and the freshest so I was on a mission to try as many places as I could. I've decided to order from this place since it was right next door to our hotel. The carry out order was ready in about 20 minutes, great!!! 
I ordered my usual Dragon Roll, Rainbow Roll and a couple others, don't remember the name now. The Dragon Roll is usually the tastiest one but here it was just OK, small pieces of eel, shrimp tempura is a bit dry, no unagi sauce in sight. Rainbow Roll and others were good, the fish was super fresh and a lot of it, very little rice.
I also ordered seaweed salad and in my opinion the portion was just RIDICULOUSLY small for $4.00, it was probably 1/2-3/4 of a cup.

The service was great but for about $50 carry out order I was expecting a little more quantity. I guess for SF this is a good value.
author: Love S.

description: The service and sushi chefs were so hospitable, the tuna sashimi was amazing, the roles were unique and created a feast in your mouth & truly an amazing Japanese experience. For a Monday evening, the stream of people was steady, the ambiance lovely, everything clean, & a must for any sushi fanatic.
author: Emilia D.

description: It's some pretty good sushi. Unfortunately the portions are tiny, otherwise I might go 5. I ordered a plethora of things on the menu and everything was solid. My advice would be to order the caterpillar roll. It's a lot better than your average caterpiller roll.
author: Brian B.

description:
This place isn't as trendy as others in the neighborhood, but is has the best sushi.  The yellowfin is world class, Blue Hawaiian is a favorite roll.

If you want straight up good sushi, this is the place.
author: Kevin K.

description: This is a great neighborhood sushi spot run by a lovely Japanese couple - Wiley & Michelle. The fish is always fresh and the sushi/rolls are very reasonably priced. I live in Pac Heights and could walk here but often times I'll drive because I can! READ: Atami has PARKING!! They share a lot w/ the florist next door. Pull into the back lot and park your car to the left (behind the flower shop).
author: Alice W.

description:
This place NEVER disappoints. Their fish is so freakin' fresh, I swear they have a massive salt water and separate fresh water tank in the back.  The yellow tail sashimi melts in your mouth...so good.  The service is always impeccable and the owners are sweethearts. This is that kinda place that you want to see when you get to heaven.  I love sushi, but it isn't my husband's fav so I find myself going here with the girls  or simply driving by and whispering 'I love you I miss you I will see you soon I hope'  and then on home to hamburger helper...which ALWAYS disappoints. 
Anyway...Atami rocks and is also very affordable. The other thing that  is quite nice about it is it never seems to be crazy packed. I went Fri. night with some friends and we waited about 10 minutes...this was around 7:30! That's pretty damn good.  It is seriously one of best sushi places I've ever been to.
author: Kris K.

description: Quality of fish is over the top fresh....so good! Favorite rolls are Hurricane,kamikaze, & 49'ers... portions are traditional Japanese.  YUM!
author: David Gemme T.

description: Stumbled into this little place on a recent trip to San Francisco from New York. It was so good we went twice in the space of 4 days. Family run and small so reserve or be willing to wait on weekends. After experiencing most of the top sushi restaurants in New York I can say this place beats places like Nobu, Sushi of Gari and Sushi Seki hands down, upside down, hands tied behind your back. Not only is it friendly and unpretentious, its the best fish I've ever tasted and I still dream about it, especially the yellow tail and uni. One more thing, our bill at the end of the night was less than any sushi restaurant we have ever visited. Heaven!
author: Sam R.

description: What a cute little place - very clean and cozy. The sushi is wow!
author: Daria G.

description: I spotted this sushi joint couple of weeks ago. I was on my way to walk my pup at the crissy field. I decided to take a shot of their bento box lunch special. I'd say it's a pretty good deal. You get 2 items with rice, salad, and miso soup. Verdict: If you happen to be cruising along lombard street and lookin' for some good lunch deal, Atami Sushi is a good spot to try.
author: Jules S.

description: Sushi here is always fresh and is a nice change from normal Marina sushi spots - no crazy rolls with crazy sauces to cover up bad fish, but a nice quiet place to enjoy fresh sushi.  And can't say enough great things about Michelle.....
author: Kevin C.

description: Nice place for a quiet atmosphere with soothing smooth jazz ;)  but might be a little awkward for a first date...   The smaller sushi portions were very good.  Prices are fitting for the quality of the fish.  Will go back.  Hopefully they will find a new radio station before then.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Very good food. This family-run place knows how to make and present sushi. We came late (9:30) and still needed to wait a couple of minutes, always a good sign! 

They accommodated us by seating us next to each other, something we always appreciate. While the recommendations of what's popular didn't thrill, we ordered off the menu and loved the texture and flavor of the fish.

Good seaweed salad and miso soup. Great spider roll.
author: Simone E.

description:
My girlfriend and I went last night after we were disappointed that Zushi Puzzle was all packed. So we head down the Atami for our second visit, and it was great, just like the first. 

The decor is very simple, and there always seems to be tables available. I could not imagine this place completely busy, since they have 1 waitress and 1 chef. The place was about 60% full and the service was already becoming quite slow. We weren't in a rush, so it wasn't that big of a deal, but we were hungry and thirsty after coming from 24 Hour Fitness! Keep the water comin!

The sashimi is always fresh and the rolls are unique from the other places we visit in SF. I would recommend the Blue Hawaii and Raider Rolls! Fantastic!
author: SandJ C.

description:
Neon lights flicker
The service is slow as snails
Sushi is OK
author: Doug B.

description:
i really have no idea what's worse ... 

OSOME (http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=EKdyI4jpUF29YtPkKiCtcg&q=osome)

or 

ATAMI... 

it's like heads or tails .... 

owned by chinese folks ...

when ordering udon, you get 2 shrimp tempuras, right? well, he requested tempura to be put on the side, but was surprised by a friendly visitor floating on top of the udon. not no bug, but a soggy tempura floating on top ... the lady (owner) comes by and says "sry about the tempura on top" BEFORE he makes a comment, while his friend got the same udon but with NO tempura? she doesn't even bother getting him another one, but takes the order at the other table, and comes back with 2 tempura literally AFTER he finished his udon.

iono ...

very cute, japanese-y looking place, but of course, in the heart of the marina, what do you expect... reminds me of sweet aroma 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz/sweet-aroma-san-francisco#hrid:JrcCtnEro0uO2LqfJuGsuQ)
food isn't all that great either, sushi was so so too ... 

asking for water few times, even when it wasn't that busy, she told us to hold. she brings out the food, the menu, but no water ...
author: Jennifer S.

description: I went to Atami for take-out sushi. Their parking (right next to it, by the flower shop) makes it really easy. The service was welcoming and good. I ordered edamame, some soba noodles and nigri sushi. Food was prepared fairly rapidly, packed nicely and - of course - very good! Overall a great experience!
author: Reza M.

description:
This is by far my favorite sushi place in SF!  Nothing fancy about the restaurant however the staff is so nice, the fish is SO fresh and every time I've been it's been a very relaxing experience where I leave very satisfied.  The Red Devil roll is my favorite!  The miso soup is also really good but be careful, it always comes out really hot!  

Don't go to Atami expecting a scene or vibrant atmosphere.  This is the perfect place to go during the week when you just want to relax and have some great food.  The rolls are on the smaller side but personally I like that.  I hate having to cover my mouth when I chew because other places make the rolls way too big.
author: Courtney C.

description: We love Wylie and Michelle.  It's nice to have dinner at a place where they are happy to see you.  Have the elegant, ginza and burrito roll.  Delish!
author: Lauren J.

description: Good sushi, but the rolls are pretty small, which was a little disappointing.  Great service and we didn't have to wait on a Friday night, which means a lot in this neighborhood.
author: Mitzi C.

description: Good but not great. Fish was very fresh, but they overcooked the rice. Very nice atmosphere. More traditional than trendy. If this restaurant were in another city, I'd go back, but in SF, I'll keep trying.
author: Fred S.

description: Good service, decent sushi, decent price, amazing miso and edamame!
author: Geno B.

description: The fish is consistently fresh which i like about this place. We ordered a few take-out rolls this week and it was very good. The sushi is not stufffed with a thick layer of rice like other places. I recommend the hurricane roll ...
author: Tiffany L.

description: In my years in SF my husband and I became Atami regulars. The staff is very kind and it has a very intimiate feel. We always had wonderful, wonderful sushi there - always fresh, tasty, and what we hoped for. It was our favorite 'routine' sushi place to hit on the weekends. Highly recommended!
author: Monica K.

description:
I have been a customer at this place for years.  I find myself coming to this restaurant regularly although it is out of the way (I live in Oakland, work in Berkeley...).   

Why?  The sushi is great.  The cooked dishes (the "grill" part of the name) are good, but are definitely not as good as the sushi.

This is a mom (the server) and pop (the sushi chef) place, and I always find the service to be very good on a regular basis.
author: Alan P.

description: Atami is by far the BEST Sushi Restaurant I've been to in San Francisco.  Everything about the restaurant makes it my favorite: relaxing, quiet atmosphere; friendly wait-staff; and most importantly, the SUSHI is phenomenal.  The best I've eaten!!  The Sushi is not stuffed/rolled with a thick layer of rice, so you can actually taste the fish on top or the other goodies inside the roll.  I love that they are always busy, but will still have space for you...  Best kept secret in SF!!!
author: Joey B.

description:
this cozy restaurant is an unassuming gem in the marina district: food 4.5 stars, very clean decor, quite reasonable prices, high quality fish, average portion sizes, super polite staff, and even with the availability of offstreet parking. 
definitely will be back!
author: O M.

description: Went here to meet a friend.  Food was decent at a reasonable price.  No really crazy rolls, just he standard stuff, but all good.  Pretty small, but nice place.  Service was good.  Basically a decent, cheap, sushi place in the Marina/Cow Palace that is a far better option than Mas Sake down the street.
author: Eric M.

description: Clean, great service, fresh fish- delicious! This is not a hip happening place. But, the food is very good.
author: C B.

description: This is going to reveal my underappreciation for the art that is great sushi, but how long does it take to prepare raw fish?  Even if you are applying the most exquisite of knife work, it should not take over an hour to get two orders of sashimi and two fairly basic rolls.  When we first arrived the place was virtually empty, but we had to get the waitress' attention to take our order. 15 minutes later she brought miso soup and seaweed salad.  Another 20 minutes later came one order of sashimi and the spicy tuna roll.  20 minutes after that came the last roll and sashimi.  Yes, there was only one waitress and one chef, but as previously mentioned, the place was not slammed.  I kept wondering what would have happened if we had decided to get take-out - we would have waited forever! At the end of the day, the sushi was good, not great, but our mood was spoiled by how long it took.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
i really liked atami the first time i tried it (take out).  small, tight and simple rolls, no sauce.  small, tight and simple nigiri.  pretty good flavor on the fish.  just looking at the sushi, i thought it was made by japanese.    

the second time i tried atami, i dined in.  obviously, i was mistaken about the japanese chefs; they weren't.  but whatever, good sushi and good technique and good sushi and good technique.  but when the food came out, i thought maybe i had ordered take out from a different place.  the rolls were loose and sloppy and the quality of the nigiri was not very good.  i even went outside to see if i was in the wrong place.  ok, i didn't, but i wanted to.  i wonder if when i ordered take out the first time, they called out to okoze and got the order from them???

about a year later, a friend had a bday dinner here so i went.  it was ok.  wasn't as good as the first time, wasn't as bad as the second.  maybe they keep changing owners or chefs???
author: Reina M.

description: Very good sushi, very friendly owners/staff, cute, small, cozy layout.  Really, it doesn't feel like it's on Lombard at all, more like a back street in the hills somewhere.  They have parking in a small lot next door/around back and a back entrance in from the parking.  There are bunches of those funky eclectic strange rolls that seem to be so popular in San Francisco (I'm a plain fish man myself) and other standard sushi joint fare.  The fish was very fresh and tasty, though not the biggest slices I've seen.  Definitely a neighborhood joint - the kind of place that will remmeber your regular order if you keep stopping by on the way home from work.
author: J P.

description: Shhh.. don't tell anyone.. this is one of the best sushi places in the City.  Small quaint joint has absolutely the some of the most amazing rolls I've had in quite some time. Extremely comforting environment with a great husband and wife team.. who treat you right!  A must go especially if you live close.
author: Tom C.

description: Seriously, I haven't had sushi as good as Atami's before, ever. It's just wonderfully fresh, served at the exact right temperature. The 49ers roll; with salmon is SO good, with super thinly sliced lemon on top. I tried a couple of their specialty rolls and they were excellent and unlike any others I've tried elsewhere. Also, the owners are really sweet people.
author: Laurian R.

description: Have been coming here for 10 years, and it remains one of my favorite restaurants of all time due to a combination of things: spotlessly clean (one of the cleanest bathrooms I've ever encountered at a restaurant), excellent food, nice atmosphere, most friendly and accommodating staff (family), and parking.  The chef is quite willing to create something to your preference for sushi or entree.  As at many places, it can be slow and noisy at peak times, but I try to eat early to avoid this.  I did much prefer when they used to play Japanese music instead of the radio rock which detracts from the atmosphere.  I'll gladly pay for all these qualities, which VERY few restaurants match.
author: Jill S.

description: now our favorite sushi joint in the city-- in sharp contrast to the several other sushi restaurants on Lombard, the lovely couple that owns the place has made artistry and fine attention to detail a regular part of the experience. Creative dishes, a very intimate ambiance, highly personalized service, and fair prices are how I'd sum up Atami. When we first started going there, we were worried that there wasn't enough regular business to keep them afloat, but now it seems to be a little busier every time we go--still hardly ever have to wait for a table though.
author: Max M.

description: This is the place to get amazing nigiri and probably sashimi too since the fish is so fresh and the flavor is phenominal!  Also order the Atami Yummy roll and Rock n roll.  Atmosphere is on the simple and quieter side, ideal if you just want to eat sushi without a big scene or long wait to be seated.  The menu is limited compared to just about every other sushi restaurant I have been to in the city, and there isn't anything unique to order.  Still, the basics they have are excellent.
author: Ali G.

description:
pretty good! the service was very personal and pleasant.  all the nigiri we chose were fresh and delicious.  the seared tuna salad was surprisingly tasty, with a tangy dressing.

but it was coooold inside. brrr.
author: caitlin c.

description: Good food, and outstanding sushi. One aspect that stood out to me is that in their chicken dishes they dont use fatty, cheap chicken thighs, they actually use breasts. The service was great as well. The only aspect that was off putting was that some lady decided she needed to breast feed her baby every five minutes while she was eating.
author: Justin L.

description: Really good sushi!  I had never had blue fin tuna before, and it was love at first taste.  In fact, all their fish was amazing.  I love how they bring each roll out one-at-a-time, so you're not just stuffing your face with everything all at once (which, come on...  it's hard not to stuff your face when they bring it all at once).   The burrito roll (on the specials menu) was also fantastic and the service was perfect.  If I had to pick one gripe, it would be that certain things were a little bit too pricey.  I don't like paying $11 for a small salad with barely ANY fish on it, but maybe they're just trying to keep up with all the other marina sushi joints.  Every sushi lover should try this place -- and be sure to order the blue fin tuna nigiri!  YUM!
author: Jacquie M.

description: If you want quiet, cozy, and intimate sushi dining, then this is your place.  The service was fast and friendly (but I was also only 1 of 2 people there at the time).  The sushi was definitely delicious but a little pricey for the size of the rolls.  I know that area is high rent though.
author: C C.

description: great quality sushi and interesting rolls served by super sweet Michelle.  quiet place to take a date and talk and I think there's free parking on the right hand side at the motel next door.
author: Rob L.

description: The sushi was very fresh and tasty. Service was very friendly but very slow. I'd recommend sitting at the bar where you're less likely to be forgotten, but plan on waiting a while for everything.
author: Katy O.

description: I live right around the corner from this place so my boyfriend and I will dine here if we're too lazy to cook and want something tasty and light. It is small with a very small staff but offers consistently  fresh sushi and friendly service. I always order sashimi. A bit pricey, but worth it.
author: Angel K.

description: Very fresh, excellent food with a quiet, low-key atmosphere.  Michelle and her husband run the whole operation so you get very individual and personal service.  Parking in the back is a plus on a rainy night...
author: Ryan K.

description:
We approached the door and saw that not a single person was inside the place. Doesn't that usually foretell negative food quality? Or is that merely a psychological game we play with ourselves -  we want what everyone else wants. It was 7pm, but there we were, the only ones in the restaurant.  

Here's what we ordered:
Sunomono salad
Seared Ahi tuna
Sake Nigiri
Hamachi Nigiri
Hurricane Roll - spicy tuna with tempura with albacore on the outside

The food was fresh with zero hints of fishy taste/smell. If you want quality sushi without all the sauces to hide the real fish, this is the place for you.

Service was excellent, attentive, yet not overbearing. This will definitely will be one of my normal sushi spots going forward.
author: Jason F.

description: What can I say.....we have been coming here for over 5+ yrs, its the best sushi, always fresh and a great place to go to for a nice quiet night out. The Tokyo Tower is my favorite!!!
author: Elisa L.

description:
This is a great Marina sushi spot.  Our friends told us about it as an alternative to our previous "go-to."  It is usually not crowded at all and the service is wonderful. We have had the same women serve us every time and she is always smiling and very friendly.  

The special rolls are always a good choice and traditional ones like Saki Maki are solid.  Not the right place to go to for boys night saki bombs, but perfect for a relaxing weekday sushi craving.
author: Robert D.

description:
My wife and I live right around the corner and always pass by this little place on our way to somewhere else.  We finally made the decision to check it out with some of our friends visiting from the east bay.  Its a very quaint little spot.  The service was very friendly, we made a reservation at 6pm on Saturday for an 8:30pm seating and we sat right down.   

The six of us that went to dinner are all sushi lovers and we loved the food.  The fish was very fresh, the rolls were creative (but not over the top), and the atmosphere was very comfortable.  We ate and drank for over 2 1/2 hours and never felt rushed.  It was a great dining experience, and affordable.  We will definitely be going back in the near future.

The only reason that I didn't give it a 5-star rating is that the background music wasn't my specific taste.  It was sort of that Muzac-style automated music that is piped in from a subscription service.  Its wasn't terrible, but the background music could be slightly improved in my opinion.  All-in-all, its a fabulous spot for sushi in the city!
author: Marc G.

description: DELICIOUS. Thats all im gonna say.
author: Yvonne N.

description: The sushi is really, really fresh. Get the salmon nigiri...amazing. The atmosphere is great, very comfortable, plus it's family-owned. We try to go there at least once a week.
author: Connie Z.

description: Ahhh... my favorite neighborhood sushi place!!! No place like this one. It's run by lovely Michelle and her husband. AMAZING rolls in my opinion. Creative, and not an overdone mess that ends up all over your shirt and table. Each one is unique: Buritto roll is excellent. There is one that is heated and is to die for! The Deluxe maybe? My girlfriends and I used to go once a week... now less since we all have b.f.'s. Another huge plus is that there is parking in the back. When one of my girlfriends moved out of the area, Michelle brought us smiles and a complimentary sake. They work hard to take care of their loyal customers. A good family with a good business!
author: B H.

description: The service was mediocre, the sushi wasn't that great, and they were really stingy with their ginger! I definitely don't think it deserves 4 stars and I wouldn't go back there again.
author: Sasha G.

description: Not impressed at all.  It is worth walking the extra couple blocks and spending a little more for the far superior sushi at Zushi Puzzle.
author: Ethan K.

description: Solid sushi, fresh fish.  Super staff.    Not a Jumping Joint, but a Cool Crowd.  Quite Quiet.
author: Happy C.
